Mukhyamantri Pichhda Varg Evam Ati Pichh.details:
The scheme &quot;Mukhyamantri Pichhda Varg Evam Ati Pichhda Varg Kaushal Vikas Prashikshan Yojana&quot; was launched by the Backward Classes and Extremely Backward Classes Welfare Department, Government of Bihar. It aims to enhance the employability and income-generating capacity of youth from backward and extremely backward communities through skill development training. Under this scheme, free domain-specific skilling programs are provided to youth to help them become job-ready or self-employed. 
> **Scheme Implementation**

The scheme is implemented by the Bihar State Backward Classes Finance and Development Corporation, in coordination with the Bihar Skill Development Mission (BSDM).
> **Training**

Training is conducted through Skill Development Centres (SDCs) approved by BSDM under various sectors like IT, construction, beauty & wellness, and more.
Mukhyamantri Pichhda Varg Evam Ati Pichh.benefits:
**Free Skill Training:** 

- Domain Skilling Programs in various sectors like Apparel, Beauty & Wellness, Construction, Electronics, IT-ITES, Retail, etc.

**Certification:** 

- Candidates receive certificates post successful completion of training and assessment.

**Placement Support:** 

- Support for employment or self-employment opportunities after course completion.
Mukhyamantri Pichhda Varg Evam Ati Pichh.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Bihar.
1. The applicant should belong to the Backward Class or Extremely Backward Class category.
1. The applicant should be between 18 and 45 years of age.
1. The applicant should possess the Aadhaar number (mandatory for Aadhaar-based registration).

application process.process: Application Process for the Applicant Visit the Official Portal Interested candidates must visit the official website of the  Bihar Skill Development Mission  (BSDM). Search for Nearest Skill Development Centre (SDC) On the homepage, click on “Click here for your nearest center”. Then select “Kushal Yuva Program – Find Centers”. Choose the KYP course, select a preferred search mode (e.g., by district, block, or pincode), and fill in the required details. A list of Skill Development Centres (SDCs) matching the criteria will be displayed. Document Preparation The applicant must gather self-attested copies of all necessary documents (Aadhaar, caste certificate, residence proof, educational qualifications, etc.) as per the course requirements. Centre Visit and Registration The applicant should personally visit the nearest Skill Development Centre (SDC) for document verification and registration assistance. Application Process for the Skill Development Centres Candidate Identification Local SDCs identify eligible candidates from the Backward Class (BC) and Extremely Backward Class (EBC) categories through community outreach and awareness activities. Document Collection and Upload All required documents are collected from the candidate and uploaded to the BSDM portal by the SDC for record and processing. Aadhaar Verification The applicant's Aadhaar number is verified digitally to confirm identity and eligibility. Batch Formation A training batch is formed comprising a minimum of 20 and a maximum of 40 candidates. Approval by the Corporation Upon successful formation and verification of the batch, the Bihar State Backward Classes Finance and Development Corporation grants formal approval for the commencement of training. Training Delivery Certified trainers at BSDM-approved SDCs deliver domain-specific skill training under the prescribed curriculum. Attendance and performance are monitored digitally.

Rural Technology Complex.details: The scheme &quot;Rural Technology Complex&quot; implemented by the Govind Ballabh Pant National Institute of Himalayan Environment (NIHE), aims to support livelihood enhancement in the Himalayan region through the application of need-based, eco-friendly technologies. The scheme involves the establishment of Rural Technology Complex(RTC) within institutional premises, where local technological needs are addressed by training participants in sustainable practices. These sessions, focused on skill development, aim to create awareness and equip trainees with techniques to improve their income generation capacities using low-cost and environmentally compatible tools. Training is provided at no cost, and is open to government officers, NGO representatives, educators, students, women, and rural self-help group members.
Rural Technology Complex.benefits: - **Free Training:** All training programmes under the scheme are provided at no cost.  - **Livelihood Enhancement:** Training equips individuals with skills for sustainable, eco-friendly income generation.  - **Practical Exposure:** Training includes hands-on learning and field demonstrations.  - **No Participation Charges:** There is no fee for training or the exposure visit to the Rural Technology Campus.
Rural Technology Complex.eligibility:
- The applicant should belong to any of the following categories:


   1. A central or state government officer or staff member.
   1. A representative of a non-governmental organisation (NGO).
   1. A student from a recognised university or educational institution.
   1. A teacher or faculty member from any recognised educational institution.
   1. A rural woman or man interested in acquiring environment-friendly livelihood-based technological skills.
   1. A member of a registered self-help group (SHG).

application process.process: The applicant must send a request letter to the Director of the institute for a visit or training. Note: For training lasting one to seven days, an advance payment must be made based on the package determined by the institute. For awareness visits to rural technical premises, no fee is payable. This service is free of charge.

Mobile Food Court Van (DAADC).details: The "Mobile Food Court Van" scheme is implemented by the Dr. Ambedkar Antyodaya Development Corporation (DAADC) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to generate self-employment opportunities in the food and beverage sector by providing loan assistance to unemployed scheduled caste individuals belonging to Antyodaya families. Under this scheme, loan is provided to the eligible beneficiaries at a concessional interest rate.
Mobile Food Court Van (DAADC).benefits: **Loan Amount:** Up to ₹6,00,000/- **Interest Rate:** 6% per annum **Contribution:** - State Government Contribution: 95 % - Beneficiary Contribution: 5% **Possible Installment Amount:** - ₹11,020/- per month (for 5 years) - ₹ 9,447/- per month (for 6 years) - ₹ 8,327/- per month (for 7 years)
Mobile Food Court Van (DAADC).eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. 1. The applicant should belong to an Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY) family. 1. The applicant’s annual family income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-. 1. The applicant should provide two guarantors to get the loan.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the  official website  of the Dr. Ambedkar Antyodaya Vikas Nigam (SC). Step 2:  On the top menu bar, click on "Apply Now". Step 3:  Click on the loan scheme name. Step 4:  Select the loan category and fill in the loan amount. Step 5:  Fill out the Application Form, enter the following details: Personal Information: Name, gender, date of birth, caste, etc. Address Information: Permanent and correspondence address Income Details: Monthly family income and source Loan Requirement: Amount needed, proposed use (e.g., business, self-employment) Bank Account Details: For loan disbursement Step 6:  Upload scanned copies of the Caste certificate, Income certificate, Aadhaar card, Passport-size photo, Bank passbook (first page), and Residence proof. Step 7:  Double-check all details. Click on “Preview” to verify. If all details are correct, click “Submit”. Step 8:  The applicant will receive an Application ID/Reference Number. Save or print the acknowledgement for future tracking.

Shilpi Gram Scheme (Scheduled Caste / Sc.details: The "Shilpi Gram Scheme (Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe)" scheme was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to preserve, promote, and develop traditional artisan crafts among Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, free skill development training, infrastructure development, raw material support, and marketing facilities are provided to SC/ST artisans in identified artisan villages. > **Objectives:** - To identify and revive traditional crafts as sustainable livelihood options. - To categorize artisans into skilled, semi-skilled, and unskilled and provide training accordingly. - To create awareness, provide orientation training, and develop artisan skills. - To promote new technologies and designs and set up raw material depots. - To provide marketing support through exhibitions, fairs, and permanent haats. - To collect baseline data for planning financial assistance, marketing, and welfare.
Shilpi Gram Scheme (Scheduled Caste / Sc.benefits:
**Free Skill Training:**

- Training is offered at three levels — awareness & orientation, basic training, and vocational training.

**Infrastructure Support:**

- Development of artisan villages with electricity, water, roads, and common facilities.

**Marketing Assistance:**

- Support for exhibitions, fairs, permanent haats, and promotion of Uttarakhand-branded craft products.

**Raw Material Support:**

- Establishment of raw material depots like Wool Bank, Wood Bank.

**Recognition & Awards:**

- Awards for outstanding artisans and participation in national/international fairs.

**Exposure Visits:**

- Exposure tours to other states with advanced handicrafts.
Shilpi Gram Scheme (Scheduled Caste / Sc.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must belong to a Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe community. 1. The applicant's annual income should not exceed ₹1,05,600 in rural areas and ₹1,29,840 in urban areas.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  The interested applicant downloads the  application form   from the official website. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the office of the Development Block Office. Selection Process: Step 1:  A selection committee chaired by the Chief Development Officer (CDO) selects institutions and trainees.

Term Loan Scheme (GSKVN).details: The "Term Loan Scheme" is implemented by the Gujarat Safai Kamdar Vikas Nigam (GSKVN) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to uplift safai kamdars (scavengers) and their dependents by providing financial assistance in the form of term loans to help them take up various trades or professions for self-employment. The scheme also aims to integrate them into the mainstream society by enabling them to move away from the traditional, inhuman, and hazardous occupation of manual scavenging and lead a life of dignity. Under this scheme, beneficiaries are eligible to receive term loans ranging from ₹1,00,000 to ₹15,00,000 to start income-generating self-employment activities or projects. The scheme is implemented with the support of the National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC), New Delhi, in collaboration with the State Government, through the Gujarat Safai Kamdar Vikas Nigam.
Term Loan Scheme (GSKVN).benefits: ***Loan Amount:***__ - loans from ₹1,00,000/- to ₹15,00,000/- are provided at an interest rate of 6% for various businesses.
Term Loan Scheme (GSKVN).eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should be a scavenger/sanitation worker or a dependent of one. 1. The applicant should be willing to use the loan for starting income-generating self-employment activities or projects.

application process.process: Registration Process: Step 1:  Visit the Social Justice & Empowerment Department website:  https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in Step 2 : Click on “Please Register Here” on the homepage. Step 3:  Fill in your personal details as per Aadhaar. Step 4:  Create a password and submit the form. Step 5:  Verify details and click “Confirm”. Step 6:  You will receive your User ID & Password via SMS/email. Login Process: Step 1:  Go to the portal homepage. Step 2:  Enter your User ID, Password, and Captcha. Step 3:  Click “Login” to access your dashboard. Application Process: After login, complete your User Profile (first-time only). Step 1:  Homepage will show eligible schemes – click on the one you want. Step 2:  Fill out the scheme application form. Step 3:  Upload the required documents. Step 4:  Review all entries, agree to terms, and click “Save Application” & note down your Application Number for tracking. Track Application: Step 1:  Click on “ View Application Status ” Step 2:  Enter your Application Number and Date of Birth Step 3:  Click “View Status” to check progress

SAKSHAM - KVK 2.0.details: The scheme "SAKSHAM - KVK 2.0"was launched by the Gujarat Skill Development Mission (GSDM), Labour and Employment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide access to skill development programmes to a wide range of beneficiaries at taluka/village level, enhancing employability and competitiveness in the job market while promoting entrepreneurship. The scheme provides Short-Term Training in National Skills Qualifications Framework Level 1, 2, and 3 courses along with Gujarat Council of Vocational Training courses, and implements Special Projects for marginalized and vulnerable groups. The applicant must be a domicile of Gujarat, looking for fresh skills, reskilling, upskilling opportunities. The scheme is implemented by GSDM through empanelled Implementation Partners across all 33 districts of Gujarat. The applications are accepted online through the GSDM portal.
SAKSHAM - KVK 2.0.benefits: ##### ***Training Benefits*** - Short-Term Training of approximately 300 hours duration in National Skills Qualifications Framework/Gujarat Council of Vocational Training aligned courses. - On-the-Job Training as an integral part of Short-Term Training with duration determined by specific job roles. - Specialized training courses for Special Projects tailored to meet specific needs of marginalized and vulnerable groups. - Training conducted at Saksham Centers established at taluka/village level. - Access to certified Training of Trainers trainers endorsed by respective Sector Skill Councils. - Industry expert and entrepreneur guest lectures on rotational basis. ##### ***Assessment and Certification Benefits*** - Assessment and certification carried out by Sector Skill Councils/Gujarat Council of Vocational Training. - Assessment and certification fees paid directly by Gujarat Skill Development Mission. - Candidates eligible for assessment with minimum 70% attendance for classroom training and 70% for On-the-Job Training. ##### ***Employment Support Benefits*** - Placement assistance and employment opportunities from Implementation Partners. - Multiple placement options including wage employment, probation with stipend/salary, service aggregator portal registration, job work acceptance, self-employment, and apprenticeship opportunities. - Post-placement tracking and support services. ##### ***Infrastructure and Facility Benefits*** - Training centers with basic amenities including drinking water and separate toilets for boys and girls. - Aadhaar-based biometric attendance system and Internet Protocol-based Closed-Circuit Television cameras with Digital Video Recorder systems. - Teaching aids, furniture, fittings, and equipment as per job role requirements. ##### ***Conditions*** - Minimum 70% attendance required for classroom training to be eligible for completion. - Minimum 70% attendance required for On-the-Job Training to be eligible for completion. - Original Aadhaar card verification required during assessment to prevent duplication. - Adherence to batch timings from earliest 7:00 AM to latest 7:00 PM with minimum 4 hours and maximum 8 hours per day training.
SAKSHAM - KVK 2.0.eligibility: - The applicant must be a domicile of Gujarat. - The applicant must be minimum 14 years of age as per labour law for non-hazardous occupations. - The applicant must be maximum 59 years of age for Short Term Training. - The applicant must be maximum 65 years of age for Special Projects. - The applicant must be looking for fresh skills, reskilling, or upskilling opportunities for Short Term Training. - The applicant must be out of education, school/college dropout, or unemployed youth for Short Term Training. - The applicant must belong to marginalized, vulnerable groups requiring special attention or specific job roles for Special Projects. > ***Eligibility for Special Projects*** The applicant must belong to one of the following categories: _Jail Inmates, Former Prisoners, Juvenile homes, Scheduled Castes, Women, Members of the Transgender Community, Members of the Beggar Community, Senior Citizens and Old age homes, Patients recovered from Mental illness, Children in Shelter Homes and Orphanages, Scheduled Tribes, Economically Backward Communities, Persons with Disabilities, Rural Artisans, or Migrant Workers._

application process.process: Step 1:   Registration, Login and Profile Setup Visit the  official website  of Gujarat Skill Development Mission and navigate to the SAKSHAM - KVK 2.0 application portal. Create a new user account on the portal by providing basic personal information including name, mobile number, and email address. Verify your mobile number through OTP sent via SMS and verify email address through verification link. Login to your registered account using credentials and complete your detailed profile including personal information, educational qualifications, employment status, and contact details. Upload a recent passport-size photograph in JPEG format with maximum file size of 100kb. Step 2:   Selection of Scheme, Job Role, and Training Center Navigate to the SAKSHAM - KVK 2.0 scheme section and select the appropriate training category - either Short Term Training or Special Projects based on your eligibility and requirements. Browse through the available NSQF/GCVT aligned job roles listed on the portal. Select your preferred job role based on your interest, aptitude, and career objectives from the available options in your district/taluka. View the list of empanelled Implementation Partners and their Saksham Centers in your preferred taluka/village location. Select your preferred training center based on location convenience and course availability. Step 3:   Filling Application Form and Document Upload Fill the comprehensive application form with mandatory fields including personal details, educational background, employment history, family information, and preference details. Ensure all information is accurate and matches with supporting documents. Upload all required documents in PDF format with maximum file size of 2MB per document. Ensure documents are clear, legible, and properly scanned with all four corners visible. Step 4:   Application Review and Submission Review all entered information and uploaded documents for accuracy and completeness. Make necessary corrections if required and submit the application form. Note down the application reference number for future tracking. Receive application submission confirmation message on registered mobile number and email address. Download and save the application acknowledgment receipt for future reference. Grievance Redressal/Help and Support For any queries or grievances, contact Gujarat Skill Development Mission at: Address:  Dr. Jivraj Mehta Bhavan, Block No. 2, Third Floor, Gandhinagar-382010 Contact Number:  079-232-53815

Craftsmen Training Scheme.details: The "Craftsmen Training Scheme" was launched by the Directorate General of Training, Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship, Government of India. The scheme aims to ensure a steady flow of skilled workers in different trades for the domestic industry, to raise quantitatively and qualitatively the industrial production by systematic training, to reduce unemployment among the educated youth by providing them with employable skills, and to cultivate and nurture a technical and industrial attitude in the minds of the younger generation. The scheme provides systematic vocational training through a network of Industrial Training Institutes and National Skill Training Institutes located all over the country, offering comprehensive skill development programs in various trades and conducting All India Trade Tests for certification.
Craftsmen Training Scheme.benefits: ##### ***Vocational Training and Skill Development*** - **Training Duration:** Varies from 6 months to 2 years, depending on the trade.- **Trade Certification:** National Council for Vocational Training certificate upon successful completion.- **Skill Development:** Hands-on practical training in various industrial trades.- **Employment Opportunities:** Enhanced employability in domestic and international markets. ##### ***Training Infrastructure and Facilities*** - **Training Network:** Access to 15,042 Industrial Training Institutes and 33 National Skill Training Institutes.- **Modern Equipment:** Training on the latest industrial equipment and technology.- **Expert Instruction:** Training by qualified instructors and industry experts.- **Workshop Facilities:** Well-equipped workshops for practical training. ##### ***Assessment and Certification*** - **All India Trade Tests:** Conducted by the Directorate General of Training under the aegis of the National Council for Vocational Training at the end of training.- **National Recognition:** Certificates recognized across India for employment.- **Industry Standards:** Training aligned with current industry requirements and standards. ##### ***Conditions*** - Minimum 80% attendance is required to appear in the Final Trade Test. - Regular participation in practical training sessions and workshops. - Compliance with the institute rules and regulations. - Successful completion of periodic assessments and tests.
Craftsmen Training Scheme.eligibility: - The applicant must be an Indian citizen. - The applicant must meet the age requirements as specified for different trades (generally between 14 to 40 years). - The applicant must have completed the minimum educational qualifications as prescribed for specific trades (ranging from 8th standard to 12th standard). - The applicant must be able to read and write in the local language / Hindi / English. - The applicant must be physically and medically fit to undergo the specific trade training. - The applicant must not have any physical disabilities that would prevent them from performing the trade activities. - The applicant must meet specific requirements for certain trades (such as color vision for electrical trades). - The applicant must demonstrate basic aptitude for the chosen trade.

application process.process: Step 1:  The candidate must visit the Industrial Training Institute and obtain the prescribed application form. Step 2:  The applicant should fill out the application form completely with accurate personal details, educational background, trade preference, and attach all required documents with proper attestation. Step 3:  The candidate must pay the prescribed application and training fees as applicable and submit the completed application form along with all supporting documents to the authorised staff of the Institute, within the specified deadline. *Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicabl e). Post-Application Processes Step 1:   Merit List and Selection Process The institutes will prepare merit lists based on educational qualifications and other criteria, and selected candidates will be notified about their admission through official communication channels. Step 2:   Admission Confirmation and Document Verification Selected candidates must report to the institute on the specified date for document verification, admission confirmation, and completion of remaining formalities, including medical examination if required. Step 3:   Training Commencement After successful admission confirmation, candidates will begin their vocational training as per the institute's academic calendar and training schedule for their respective trades. Application Deadlines Application deadlines vary by institute and are typically announced before the commencement of each academic session (usually April-May for the August session and October-November for the February session).

PM-Special Training of Geriatric Caregiv.details: The scheme "PM-Special Training of Geriatric Caregivers" was launched by the Department of Social Justice & Empowerment, Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India. The scheme aims to bridge the gap in supply and increasing demand in the field of geriatric caregivers, provide more professional services to senior citizens, and create a cadre of professional caregivers in geriatrics. The scheme provides training in four specific job roles: Geriatric Caregiver (Institutional & Home Care), Elderly Caretaker (Non-Clinical), Elderly Care Companion, and Wellness Therapist for Elderly, with an emphasis on physical, mental, and overall well-being of the elderly through a multi-disciplinary approach, including on-job training for specific courses. The scheme is implemented by the Department of Social Justice & Empowerment with the help of the National Institute of Social Defence. The applications for this scheme are accepted through registration on the Skill India Digital Hub (SIDH).
PM-Special Training of Geriatric Caregiv.benefits: > ***Skill Training*** The scheme provides training to candidates in four specific job roles: Geriatric Caregiver (Institutional & Home Care) (480 hours), Elderly Caretaker (Non-Clinical) (360 hours), Elderly Care Companion (450 hours), and Wellness Therapist for Elderly (570 hours). > ***On-Job Training (OJT)*** For job roles as mandated by the National Council for Vocational Education and Training, On-Job Training is provided, with its duration guided by the approved qualification pack. > ***Assessment and Certification*** The skill assessment is conducted by empaneled Assessment Agencies, and a certificate is made available to candidates in physical and digital form, along with corresponding 'credits' as per the National Credit Framework of MSDE. The assessment fee is provided under the scheme. > ***Re-assessment Opportunity*** Every candidate is offered one chance of re-assessment free of cost, to be borne from the scheme. > ***Placement Support*** Apprenticeship is promoted, and training linked to captive placements (training and placement within the same industry) will be encouraged. Trainees are also encouraged to participate in Rozgar Melas for placement, with Training Institutes having tie-ups for proper placement.
PM-Special Training of Geriatric Caregiv.eligibility: - The applicant must be a citizen of India. - The applicant must meet the minimum age as specified in the respective job role. - The applicant must be less than 40 years of age. - The applicant must have the minimum education qualification as per the required job roles. - The applicant must not indulge in any substance abuse.

application process.process: Official Website https://www.skillindiadigital.gov.in Step 1:   Account Registration Navigate to the Skill India Digital Hub (SIDH) at https://www.skillindiadigital.gov.in, and click "Register". Provide your mobile number and verify via OTP. Provide your email ID. Set a strong password of minimum 8 characters. Complete the basic registration form and proceed to profile creation. Step 2:   Profile Creation and e-KYC Fill in your complete personal details including full name, date of birth, gender, category, and current address. Enter your Aadhaar number and click "Verify Aadhaar" for automatic e-KYC. The system will auto-populate your basic details and send OTP to your Aadhaar-linked mobile number for final authentication. Ensure all information matches exactly with your Aadhaar card. Upload the required documents in the specified file format and file size. Step 3:   Course and Institute Selection Browse through available geriatric caregiver training courses. Select your preferred training course. Choose up to three empaneled training institutes in order of preference. The system will allocate seats based on availability and your preference order during final selection process. Step 4:   Application Review and Submission Carefully review all entered information, uploaded documents, and selected preferences in the application preview section before submission. Read and accept the terms and conditions, scheme guidelines, and declaration. Click "Submit Application" to generate unique Application Reference Number (ARN) and receive confirmation SMS and email. Post-Application Processes Step 1:   Verification and Selection The application verification (15-30 working days) by Project Appraisal Committee under Joint Secretary of DoSJE. Selected candidates receive training institute allocation, batch schedule, and joining instructions through registered communication channels. Step 2:   Training Enrollment and Support Report to assigned training institute as per schedule provided in selection notification with original documents for physical verification. Complete the free training program. Upon successful completion, receive government-recognized certification. Grievance Redressal Email:  secretary-sje@nic.in Phone:  +91-11-23382065 Address:  Shastri Bhavan, Dr. Rajendra Prasad Road, New Delhi - 110001

P1, P2, P3, P4, SIV, Guided Flying.details: The scheme “P1, P2, P3, P4, SIV, Guided Flying” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Tourism Development Board under the Department of Tourism, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to develop skilled and certified paragliding professionals from Uttarakhand who can work as Tandem Pilots, Instructors, or Competitors in the tourism sector.
P1, P2, P3, P4, SIV, Guided Flying.benefits: **Beneficiaries can work in firms operating as:** - Tandem Pilots - Instructors - Competitors
P1, P2, P3, P4, SIV, Guided Flying.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be between 18 to 30 years of age. 1. The applicant must be educated. 1. The applicant must be mentally and physically healthy. > The total number of 215 beneficiaries will be selected.

application process.process: The prescribed application form must be duly filled out and submitted along with all required documents to the office of the District Tourism Development Officer. After the completion of the selection tests, the District Tourism Development Officer forwards the list of selected applicants to the headquarters for further processing.

Special Basic Mountaineering Course.details: The scheme “Special Basic Mountaineering Course” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Tourism Development Board under the Department of Tourism, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to enhance mountaineering skills among youth, prepare them to become certified guides, and promote adventure tourism in Uttarakhand.
Special Basic Mountaineering Course.benefits: The beneficiary will become a certified guide upon completing the mountaineering course.
Special Basic Mountaineering Course.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a youth of Uttarakhand. 1. Preference will be given to candidates who have completed the Low Altitude Guide Course from a recognized institution or an Adventure Foundation Course run by DTDC. > The total number of 25 beneficiaries will be selected.

application process.process: Applicants must complete the prescribed application form and submit it along with the required documents to the office of the District Tourism Development Officer. Upon completion of the tests, the District Tourism Development Officer will forward the list of shortlisted candidates to the headquarters. Final selection of participants will be made by a committee constituted at the headquarters.

Kisan-Vaigyanik Sangoshthi.details: The scheme “Kisan-Vaigyanik Sangoshthi” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Council for Biotechnology under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to guide farmers and youth in biotechnology-based farming and animal husbandry by providing technical training and solutions to enhance self-employment and income generation.
Kisan-Vaigyanik Sangoshthi.benefits: Through Kisan-Vaigyanik Sangoshthi, the Council provides technical guidance from subject matter experts to the state’s farmers, helping to address challenges in biotechnology-based agriculture and animal husbandry. The Council also continuously works to improve farmers’ livelihoods and promote self-employment by sharing technical knowledge on hydroponics, soilless farming, kiwifruit cultivation, fish farming, beekeeping, vegetable production, and floriculture.
Kisan-Vaigyanik Sangoshthi.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a youth, a farmer, a member of a self-help group, or a livestock farmer.

application process.process: Such seminars are organized by the Council from time to time. For participation, farmers, youth, and students associated with agriculture from different areas are informed through brochures, leaflets, and other social media channels. Interested candidates are then registered, after which the training or seminar is conducted.

Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Incentive for.details: The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Incentive for Self-Employment" component of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance not exceeding ₹50,000/- or the actual cost, whichever is less, to needy Goan artists or their families for setting up self-employment ventures, helping them establish sustainable income sources. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Incentive for.benefits: > ***Financial Assistance*** - ₹50,000/- or the actual cost, whichever is less, shall be provided for setting up self employment venture. - The financial assistance amount shall be disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode. - The assistance is provided as a one-time grant. > ***Conditions*** - The details of the expenditure incurred along with the vouchers must be furnished to the department after utilizing the grant. - The unutilized amount out of the sanctioned amount, if any, shall be refunded to the Government within the stipulated timeframe.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Incentive for.eligibility: - The applicant must be Goan, i.e., born and brought up in Goa. - The artist must be an artist recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. - The income of the family of the applicant (from all sources) must not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum. - The applicant must not be less than 50 years in age. (The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances.) - The applicant must not be employed or self-employed at the time of application.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Incentive for.exclusions: Individuals who have already availed self-employment benefits earlier under any Government scheme, Autonomous bodies, or Corporations are not eligible.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the office of the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa, and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the  Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa. Post-Application Processes Step 1:  The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly. The Director shall give its recommendations to the sub-committee. Step 2:  The sub-committee shall consider the received applications and recommend the names of the artists which are considered fit by the sub-committee to avail the benefits under this scheme. The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released to the needy artist. Step 3:  After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance. Step 4:  After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account.

Skill Development Programme- Uttarakhand.details: The scheme “Skill Development Programme” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Council for Biotechnology under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to enhance the employability and entrepreneurial skills of students, researchers, and farmers in the field of biotechnology, thereby promoting self-employment and entrepreneurship in emerging areas of the biotechnology sector. Under this scheme, various training programmes are conducted in the following areas: - Training programme on plant production methods and cultivation through plant tissue culture. - Training programme on hydroponic and soilless farming techniques. - Training programme on drinking water and soil quality testing. - Training programme on biological and molecular genetic engineering techniques. - Training programme on the preparation of medicines from natural products derived from Himalayan plants.
Skill Development Programme- Uttarakhand.benefits: Training programs are organized to promote self-employment under the Skill Development in Critical Areas of Biotechnology. These programs range in duration from 30/45 to 90 days for undergraduate and postgraduate students, and 180 days (Dissertation Program) for postgraduate students. During the training period, selected students conduct their research and practical training in the Council’s modern research laboratories. The trainees receive hands-on training in plant tissue culture, molecular biology and genetic engineering, environmental biotechnology, hydroponics, and soilless farming. After receiving the training, beneficiaries are better able to manage their business, self-employment, and agricultural activities.
Skill Development Programme- Uttarakhand.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a graduate or postgraduate student, researcher, or farmer from subjects such as Biotechnology, Microbiology, Molecular and Genetic Biology, Environmental Biology, B.Tech in Biotechnology, or related fields.

application process.process: The Research Dissertation Programme (Dissertation) is conducted every year from January to June. Students and research scholars can also undergo training of 30, 45, or 90 days at any time of the year, according to their convenience. Candidates can apply for training of 30, 45, or 90 days by downloading the application form and guidelines from the Council’s website  www.ucb.ac.in . The duly completed application (hard copy or soft copy) should be submitted to the Council’s address after obtaining the recommendation of the competent authority, Principal, or Head of Department. Selection is based on merit. For short-term training, students are provided training in the relevant area or laboratory. For the six-month Research Dissertation Programme (Dissertation), the Council issues a notification on its website, and after receiving applications, the maximum number of students is selected for training on the basis of merit. Along with the completed application, candidates must submit photocopies of their Aadhar Card, high school, intermediate, graduation, and post-graduation certificates and mark sheets, as well as any other equivalent degree certificates, permanent residence proof, and caste certificate (if applicable).

Scheme for Giving Stipend to the Trainee.details: The scheme "Scheme for Giving Stipend to the Trainees Belonging to the Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Community Enrolled under Various Labour Welfare Centres in the State of Goa" was launched by the Department of Labour, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to give benefits under the Scheduled Caste Sub-Plan and Tribal Sub-Plan to the trainees belonging to the Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Community enrolled under various Labour Welfare Centres operating in different parts of Goa. The objective of the program is to train members of industrial workers in crafts like embroidery, needle work, cutting, and tailoring so that they become self-employed and earn income to help their families.
Scheme for Giving Stipend to the Trainee.benefits: - A stipend of ₹1,000/- per month shall be provided to the eligible applicant/trainee. - The scheme's main objective is to train the members of Industrial workers so that they become self-employed. Trainees can earn to some extent to help their family. - The stipend shall be paid monthly. - The stipend will be paid till the completion of the course of that particular academic year. - The period of stipend will commence from July to April of a particular academic year. ****If the attendance of the applicant/trainee is less than 75% for a particular month, no stipend will be paid to that trainee.***
Scheme for Giving Stipend to the Trainee.eligibility: - The applicant must be enrolled under the respective Labour Welfare Centre for a particular academic year. - The applicant must have resided in Goa for atleast 15 years. - The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Community. - The applicant must not have any source of income of her own. - The applicant must not be owing business. - The applicant must not be drawing any stipend from any other source.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Alternatively, the applicant can obtain the application form from the concerned Sewing Mistress of the respective Labour Welfare Centre where the training is being imparted. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Office of the Commissioner, Labour and Employment, Panaji. This submission must be routed through the concerned Labour Inspector of the area. Approval The application to claim the benefits under the scheme shall be reviewed and must be approved by the Commissioner, Labour and Employment. Stipend Disbursement The stipend of ₹1,000/- per month shall be paid to the approved applicant/trainee commencing from July to April of that particular academic year, provided the attendance requirements are met.

Free Pre-Recruitment Training.details: The scheme "Free Pre-Recruitment Training" is implemented by the State Sainik Board under the Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide 8 weeks of free pre-recruitment training for the Military, Paramilitary, and Police forces to the sons of ex-servicemen aged between 16 and 21 years.
Free Pre-Recruitment Training.benefits: Under this scheme, 8 weeks of free pre-recruitment training for recruitment into the Military, Paramilitary, and Police Forces is provided to eligible beneficiaries.
Free Pre-Recruitment Training.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a son of an ex-serviceman. 1. The applicant's age should be more than 16 years and less than 21 years. 1. The applicant should have passed high school with 45% marks. ***All expenses incurred on training (honorarium of trainers + food + accommodation) are borne by the Directorate of Sainik Welfare.*** **Note: 5** courses are conducted each year.

application process.process: The District Sainik Welfare Office invites applications from sons of ex-servicemen through public notifications. Applicants are required to submit the following documents: Ordinary Application Form, Birth Certificate, Aadhaar Card, Educational Certificate (at least High School or Higher Secondary), Medical Certificate, Ex-Serviceman Identity Card, and Discharge Book. The above documents should be submitted to the concerned District Sainik Welfare Office.  Once the applications are processed, selected trainees are informed about the training schedule, after which the training is conducted in the Garhwal and Kumaon divisions of the state.

State Level Awards for Divyang Persons.details: The scheme “State Level Awards for Divyang Persons” has been implemented by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, to honor the exceptional achievements and contributions of persons with disabilities in various fields. Under this scheme, a cash prize of ₹8,000/-, along with a medal and a certificate of appreciation, is awarded to outstanding individuals in categories such as disabled employees, outstanding sportspersons, and best self-employed service providers. The awards are distributed annually on the occasion of World Disability Day (December 3) to recognize and encourage excellence among persons with disabilities.
State Level Awards for Divyang Persons.benefits:
**Award Details:**

- An amount of ₹8000/- is given as a cash prize. 
- Medal and Certificate of Appreciation.

**Mode of Disbursement:**

- The amount disbursed through the cheque or bank draft at the award ceremony.

**Expected Time of Disbursement:**

- Awarded annually on December 3 (World Disability Day).
State Level Awards for Divyang Persons.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should be a person with a disability.
1. The applicant should have verifiable records of achievements or work.
1. The applicant should be in any one of the following categories:


- Differently-abled (Divyang) employee
- Outstanding Sportsperson
- Best Self-Employed Service Provider

application process.process: These awards are distributed on the occasion of World Disabled Day, observed on 3rd December. For these awards, applications are invited through newspapers. The applicant must submit the application form to the office of the District Social Welfare Officer along with the disability certificate and details of the special work done by them. After the necessary verification at the district level, and on the recommendation of the Director, Social Welfare, the Screening Committee at the government level finalizes the eligible person in each category. The award includes a certificate, a medal, and a bank draft/cheque of ₹8,000/-.

Toolkit Assistance (UKBOCWWB).details: The scheme “Toolkit Assistance” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (UKBOCWWB) under the Labour Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide registered construction workers with a toolkit, including hand gloves and other construction-related tools, worth up to ₹10,000/-.
Toolkit Assistance (UKBOCWWB).benefits: Under this scheme, registered construction workers are provided with a toolkit worth up to ₹10,000/-.
Toolkit Assistance (UKBOCWWB).eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a construction worker registered with the Uttarakhand Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

application process.process: The online application can be submitted through Shramik Suvidha Kendras. A self-attested photocopy of the Shramik Card, Aadhaar Card, and Self-Declaration Certificate must be submitted along with the application form. After departmental verification, the construction worker is provided with a toolkit, which may include hand gloves and other construction-related tools. Each beneficiary is eligible to receive this benefit only once in their lifetime.

Modular Employable Skills.details:
The Department of Technical Education, Vocational and Industrial Training, Government of Himachal Pradesh introduced a scheme to meet the demand for specific skills a PPP model was initiated between Government and Industry to promote skills development programme under the name Skill Development Initiative. Under the Skill Development Initiative Scheme (SDIS) based on Modular Employable Skills Training was introduced. It is aimed at improving the employability of the Indian workforce by providing vocational training. 
**The objective of the scheme are:-**

   1. to provide vocational training to school leavers, existing workers, ITI graduates, etc. to improve their employability by optimally utilizing the infrastructure available in Govt., private institutions and the Industry. Existing skills of the persons can also be tested and certified under this scheme.
   1. to build capacity in the area of development of competency standards, course curricula, learning material and assessment standards in the country.

**Key Features of the Scheme are:-**

   1. Demand driven short term training courses based on Modular Employable Skills (MES) decided in consultation with Industry. MES is the minimum skills set which is sufficient for gainful employment.
   1. Central government will facilitate and promote training while industry, private sector and State Governments will train the persons.
   1. Optimum utilisation of existing infrastructure to make training cost effective.
   1. Flexible delivery mechanism (part time, weekends, full time, onsite/ offsite) to suit needs of various target groups.
   1. Different levels of programmes (Foundation level as well as skill upgradation) to meet demands of various target groups.
   1. The services of existing or retired faculty or guest faculty to be utilized.
   1. Courses would also be available for persons having completed 5th standard.
   1. Testing &amp; certification of skills acquired informally.
   1. Testing of skills of trainees by independent assessing bodies, which would not be involved in training delivery, to ensure that it is done impartially.
   1. The essence of the scheme is in the certification that will be nationally and internationally recognized.

**Note:**
Under Skill Development initiative scheme (SDIS) based on Modular Employable Skills Training is provided in different ITIs / VTPs the field of Eighteen sectors namely: 

   1. Automotive Repair, 
   1. Banking and Accounting, 
   1. Beauty Culture &amp; Hair Dressing, 
   1. Electrical, 
   1. Electronics, 
   1. Garment making, 
   1. Plastic processing, 
   1. Fashion design, 
   1. Information and Communication Technology, 
   1. Fabrications, 
   1. Printing, 
   1. Production and Manufacturing, 
   1. Refrigeration and Air conditioning, 
   1. Toy making, 
   1. Paint, 
   1. Construction, 
   1. Wood work and 
   1. Industrial Electrical. 

There are 77 nos of Vocational Training Providers as on date.
Modular Employable Skills.benefits:
1. **Improved employability:** The MES scheme is designed to provide vocational training to individuals in various sectors, making them more employable in the job market.   1. **Flexible training:** The training provided under the MES scheme is modular, meaning that it can be taken up in parts, making it flexible for individuals to learn at their own pace.   1. **Certification:** The MES scheme provides certification for the skills learned, which is recognized by the industry, making it easier for individuals to get jobs.   1. **Skill development:** The MES scheme provides training in various skills, including soft skills, technical skills, and practical skills, which help in the overall development of an individual.   1. **Cost-effective:** The MES scheme is a cost-effective way of providing vocational training to individuals, as the training is provided in modules, reducing the cost of training.   1. **Encourages entrepreneurship:** The MES scheme also encourages entrepreneurship by providing training in various sectors, making it easier for individuals to start their own businesses.
**Note:** Overall, the MES scheme has been beneficial in providing vocational training to individuals and improving their employability, which is important for the growth of the Indian economy.
**MES would benefit different target groups like :**

   1. Workers seeking certification of their skills acquired informally workers and ITI graduates seeking skill upgradation early school drop-outs and unemployed Previously child labour and their families.
   1. The essence of the scheme is in the certification that will be nationally and internationally recognized. Successful persons will be awarded certificates issued by National Council for Vocational Training (NCVT).
Modular Employable Skills.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a school leaver, existing worker, or ITI graduate seeking vocational training to improve employability. 1. The applicant should be willing to undergo skill assessment, training, or certification under the scheme. 1. The applicant should meet the course-specific eligibility norms prescribed by the concerned training institution or industry.

application process.process: Visit the official website of  The Department of Technical Education,  Vocational and Industrial Training,  Government of Himachal Pradesh. Once you find the details of the scheme, including eligibility criteria, courses available, and the application process. Read the complete scheme information. If you are eligible and interested in applying for the scheme, download the application form from the website as and when the scheme is opened from the department's end. Fill in the required details in the application form, attach the necessary documents (such as educational certificates, identity proof, etc.), and submit the form to the nearest ITI (Industrial Training Institute) or VTP (Vocational Training Provider) center. The ITI or VTP center will verify your application and documents, and if everything is in order, they will enroll you in the MES scheme. After enrolling, you will receive training in your chosen course and upon successful completion of the course, you will be awarded a certificate that is recognized by the industry.

Agri-Clinics And Agri-Business Centres S.details:
A welfare scheme by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare was launched in 2002. AC&ABC aims at agricultural development by supplementing the efforts of public extension by providing extension and other services to farmers either on a payment basis or free of cost as per the business model of agri-preneur, local needs, and affordability of the target group of farmers. AC&ABC creates gainful self-employment opportunities for unemployed agricultural graduates, agricultural diploma holders, intermediate in agriculture, and biological science graduates with PG in agri-related courses. NABARD is acting as a subsidy channelizing agency for this scheme.
Committed to this program, the Government is now also providing start-up training to graduates in Agriculture, or any subject allied to Agriculture like Horticulture, Sericulture, Veterinary Sciences, Forestry, Dairy, Poultry Farming, Fisheries, etc. Those completing the training can apply for special start-up loans for ventures.
Agri-Clinics And Agri-Business Centres S.benefits:
**Agri-Clinics -** Agri-Clinics are envisaged to provide expert advice and services to farmers on various aspects to enhance the productivity of crops/animals and increase the incomes of farmers. Agri-Clinics provide support in the following areas: 1. Soil health 1. Cropping practices 1. Plant protection 1. Crop insurance post-harvest technology clinical services for animals, feed and fodder management prices of various crops in the market, etc.
**Agri-Business Centres -** Agri-Business Centres are commercial units of agri-ventures established by trained agriculture professionals. These ventures may include maintenance and custom hiring of farm equipment, sale of inputs, and other services in agriculture and allied areas, including post-harvest management and market linkages for income generation and entrepreneurship development.
The scheme covers full financial support for training and handholding, provision of loans, and credit-linked back-end composite subsidy.
**Project activities -** 1. Extension consultancy services 1. Soil and water quality cum inputs testing laboratories (with Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometers) 1. Pest surveillance, diagnostic and control services 1. Maintenance, repairs, and custom hiring of agricultural implements and machinery including micro-irrigation systems (sprinkler and drip) 1. Agri Service Centres include the three activities mentioned above (Group Activity). 1. Seed Processing Units 1. Micro-propagation through Plant Tissue Culture Labs and Hardening Units 1. Setting up of Vermiculture units, production of bio-fertilizers, bio-pesticides, and bio-control agents. 1. Setting up of Apiaries (bee-keeping) and honey & bee products' processing units 1. Provision of Extension Consultancy Services 1. Hatcheries and production of fish fingerlings for aquaculture 1. Provision of livestock health cover, setting up veterinary dispensaries & services including frozen semen banks and liquid nitrogen supply 1. Setting up of Information Technology Kiosks in rural areas for access to various agriculture-related portals 1. Feed Processing and testing units 1. Value Addition Centres 1. Setting up of Cool Chain from the farm level onwards (Group Activity) 1. Retail marketing outlets for processed agri-products 1. Rural marketing dealerships of farm inputs and outputs
Agri-Clinics And Agri-Business Centres S.eligibility:
1. The age of the applicant must be between 18 and 60 years.
1. The applicant must qualify as one of the following -


- Graduates in agriculture and allied subjects from SAUs/ Central Agricultural Universities/ Universities recognized by ICAR/ UGC. Degree in Agriculture and allied subjects offered by other agencies are also considered subject to the approval of the Department of Agriculture & Cooperation, Government of India on the recommendation of the State Government.
- Diploma (with at least 50% marks)/ Post Graduate Diploma holders in Agriculture and allied subjects from State Agricultural Universities, State Agriculture and Allied Departments, and State Department of Technical Education.
- Diplomas in Agriculture and allied subjects offered by other agencies are also considered subject to the approval of the Department of Agriculture & Cooperation, Government of India on the recommendation of the State Government.
- Biological Science Graduates with Post Graduation in Agriculture & allied subjects.
- Degree courses recognized by UGC have more than 60 percent of the course content in Agriculture and allied subjects.
- Diploma/Post-graduate Diploma courses with more than 60 percent of course content in Agriculture and allied subjects, after B.Sc. with Biological Sciences, from recognized colleges and universities.
- Agriculture-related courses at intermediate (i.e. plus two) level, with at least 55% marks.
Agri-Clinics And Agri-Business Centres S.exclusions: Retired Employees Getting Pensionary Benefits Are Not Eligible For Subsidy. However, They Can Undergo Training And Establish Self Financed Projects.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit on the  Official Website Step 2:  Fill in the mandatory fields correctly. Upload the required documents in the said format and size. Step 3:  Click "Submit" to complete the application process. The applicant can check his/her application status by visiting this link .

Agnipath Yojana.details:
The Union Cabinet on 14th June 2022 approved an attractive recruitment scheme for Indian youth to serve in the Armed Forces called AGNIPATH and the youth selected under this scheme will be known as Agniveers. AGNIPATH allows patriotic and motivated youth to serve in the Armed Forces for a period of four years. The AGNIPATH scheme has been designed to enable a youthful profile of the Armed Forces.
          &quot;Agnipath Yojana&quot; is a new HR Management scheme for the Armed Forces. Candidates inducted through this scheme will be called Agniveers. These Agniveers once enrolled into the Indian Air Force, will be governed under the Air Force Act 1950, for a period of four years. Endeavour will be made to enroll candidates as Agniveers from all parts of the nation, utilising contemporary technology (online STAR exam and associated testing methods), specialized rallies, and campus interviews at recognized technical institutes such as Industrial Training Institutes, NSQF, etc. Agniveers would form a distinct rank in the IAF, different from any other existing rank.
           As part of the enrolment process, each ‘Agniveer’ will be required to formally accept all terms and conditions of the AGNIPATH Scheme. For personnel below the age of 18 years, the enrolment form will need to be signed by the parents/guardians, in accordance with extant provisions.
        Post the period of four years, all Agniveers will go back to society. However, based on organizational requirements and policies promulgated by the IAF, Agniveers who have exited will be offered an opportunity to apply for enrolment in the IAF in the regular cadre. The skills gained by each Agniveer will be captured in a certificate to form part of his resume. These applications will be considered by a centralized board in a transparent manner and not more than 25% of the strength of the specific batch of original Agniveers will be enrolled in the IAF based on performance during their four-year engagement period as Agniveers.
           Agniveers will not have any right to be selected for further enrolment into the Armed Forces. Selection will be the exclusive jurisdiction of the Government. The enrolment as airmen into the regular cadre of Indian Air Force except for Medical tradesmen, will be available only to those personnel who have completed their engagement period as Agniveers.
Agnipath Yojana.benefits:
Agniveers will be given an attractive customized monthly package along with Risk and Hardship allowances as applicable in the three services. On completion of the engagement period of four years, Agniveers will be paid a one-time ‘SevaNidhi’ package which shall comprise their contribution including accrued interest thereon and a matching contribution from the Government equal to the accumulated amount of their contribution including interest as indicated below:
**Year****Customized Package (Monthly)** [All figures in ₹ (Monthly Contribution)]**In-Hand (70%)** [All figures in ₹ (Monthly Contribution)]**Contribution to Agniveer Corpus Fund (30%)** [All figures in ₹ (Monthly Contribution)]**Contribution to corpus fund by GoI** [All figures in ₹ (Monthly Contribution)]1st Year3000021000900090002nd Year3300023100990099003rd Year365002558010950109504th Year40000280001200012000Total contribution in Agniveer Corpus Fund after four years₹ 5.02 Lakh₹ 5.02 LakhExit After 4 Year**₹11.71 Lakh as SevaNidhi Package** (Including, interest accumulated on the above amount as per the applicable interest rates would also be paid)Note 01: The ‘Seva Nidhi’ will be exempt from Income Tax.
Note 02: There shall be no entitlement to gratuity and pensionary benefits.
Note 03: Agniveers will be provided non-contributory Life Insurance Cover of ₹48 lakh for the duration of their engagement period in the Indian Armed Forces.
Agnipath Yojana.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a citizen of India.
   1. For the 2022 intake, the age of the applicant should be between 17.5 to 23 years. For the subsequent intakes, the age of the applicant should be between 17.5 to 21 years.
   1. The applicant must fulfill the educational qualifications and physical and medical standards set by the Indian Army / Indian Navy / Indian Air Force.

**Note 01:** The Agniveers will be enrolled in the Forces under respective Service Acts for a period of four years. They would form a distinct rank in the Armed Forces, different from any other existing ranks.
**Note 02:** Upon the completion of four years of service, based on organizational requirements and policies promulgated by the Armed Forces from time to time, Agniveers will be offered an opportunity to apply for permanent enrolment in the Armed Forces.
**Note 03:** The applications for permanent enrolment will be considered in a centralized manner based on objective criteria including performance during their four-year engagement period and up to 25% of each specific batch of Agniveers will be enrolled in the regular cadre of the Armed Forces. The selection will be the exclusive jurisdiction of the Armed Forces.
**Note 04:** Agniveers will meet the medical eligibility conditions laid down for enrolment in the armed forces as applicable to respective categories/trades.
**Note 05:** The educational qualification for Agniveers will remain as in vogue for enrollment in various categories.
Agnipath Yojana.exclusions: The scheme is applicable at the soldier (jawan) level, and not the officer level.

application process.process: Enrolment will be undertaken through an online centralized system for all three services with specialized rallies and campus interviews from recognized technical institutes such as Industrial Training Institutes and National Skills Qualifications Framework, among others. Enrolment will be based on an ‘All India All Class’ basis. The candidates will be recruited as per the existing pattern of selection into the Armed Forces. HIMAYAT- Deen Dayal Upadhyaya-Grameen Ka.details:
Himayat is a placement-linked skill training programme for unemployed youth in Jammu and Kashmir and is being implemented by the Himayat Mission Management Unit, J&K State Rural Livelihoods Mission (JKSRLM), Govt. of J&K. The Programme is an outcome of the recommendations of the Dr. C. Rangarajan Committee report submitted to the Hon’ble Prime Minister on February 24, 2011 which suggested a scheme of Skill Development for school/college dropouts.
> Himayat – a Skill Development Programme for the youth has been under implementation since 2011. The Report suggested increasing the employability of youth by improving their skill sets and providing support for placement and self-employment. > Youth will be provided free skill training for a duration of 3 to 12 months, in a range of skills for which there is good market demand. At the end of the training, the youth are assured of a job and there is one year post-placement tracking to see how they are faring.
HIMAYAT- Deen Dayal Upadhyaya-Grameen Ka.benefits:
1. The Himayat shall be implemented in partnership with Project Implementing Agencies (PIAs) empaneled under; and who qualify as per the guidelines of DDU-GKY, MoRD, and GoI.
1. The Himayat programme aims to train 1,49,180 youth with placement assurance (at least 70%) of trained youth.
1. The Programme is 100 percent funded by the Government of India as a special provision under the DDU-GKY programme and no formal cap on the budget and the number of youth to be trained/ placed.
1. Technical and financial support shall be available for trainees post-training/placement as well.
1. A liberal costing for training and post-placement allowance (including tracking) has been provided under the programme for the Project Implementation Agencies (PIA).
1. The Himayat programme shall cover both urban and rural populations irrespective of levels of poverty.
1. Training shall be both Residential and Non-Residential.
1. Initial entry-level training will be provided for at least 3 months and upon completion, trainees will be placed in companies.
1. The training will include computer-oriented skills, soft skills and English communication skills, as well as the technical skills needed for the particular job.
1. There is provision for a reservation for skilling 40000 young women.
1. 1000 youth will be trained for the placements abroad.
1. The National Institute of Rural Development & Panchayati Raj (NIRD&PR) in Hyderabad has been designated as the Central Technical Support Agency (CTSA) for the appraisal of project proposals of PIAs.
1. Initial entry-level training will be provided for at least 3 months and upon completion, trainees will be placed in companies.
> If a trainee is not receiving the above entitlements he/she can call the Himayat Helpline at 01933-222364
HIMAYAT- Deen Dayal Upadhyaya-Grameen Ka.eligibility:
1. The applicant should have passed Class 8th.
1. The age of the applicant should be between 18 and 35 years. 
1. The upper age limit for women candidates, and candidates belonging to PVTGs, PwDs, transgender people, and other special groups, etc shall be 45 years.
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of the state of Jammu & Kashmir.

application process.process: Step 1: Visit the  Official Website  of Himayat. Click on Register now. Step 2: For a new registration, visit the ' Candidate Registration Form ' provided on the official website of Himayat: Step 3: Fill out the application form. Step 4: The mandatory fields are Candidate Name, Father or Guardian Name, Gender, Date of Birth, District, Block, Permanent Address, and Email ID). Step 5: The non-mandatory fields are Aadhar Number, Ration Card Number, Educational Qualification, and Interested Courses. Step 6: Select the course(s) you are interested in. Step 7: Finally, click the "Submit" icon to submit your application.

Vocational Training Of Destitute Women A.details: &quot;Vocational Training of Destitute Women and Adolescent Girls&quot; is a scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Govt. of Manipur. In this scheme, a 6-months training is provided in the Trades such as Tailoring &amp; Cutting, Embroidery, and Computer. The application form can be collected from the Welfare Training Institute, Takyel, or can be downloaded from the Department website www.socialwelfare.mn.gov.in. The completely filled and signed application forms should be submitted to the Office of Welfare Training Institute, Takyel. This is a State Sponsored Scheme and only the citizens who are domiciled in the State of Manipur can apply for this scheme. The application should be submitted through the respective District Social Welfare Officer.
Vocational Training Of Destitute Women A.benefits: A 6-months training is provided in the Trades such as Tailoring & Cutting, Embroidery, and Computer.
Vocational Training Of Destitute Women A.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a domicile of the state of Manipur.
1. The applicant should be a Destitute Woman or an Adolescent Girl.
1. The applicant should be in the 18 to 38 years age group.
1. The Minimum Educational qualification for Computer Course is 12th Pass.

application process.process: Step 1:  The  application form  can be downloaded from the Department’s website www.socialwelfare.nic.in or collected from the District Social Welfare Offices, Office of CDPOs. The application forms are also available during MeeyamgiNumit at Chief Minister’s Darbar Hall. Step 2:  Fill in the mandatory fields of the Application Form, and attach the supporting (self-attested) documents and the passport-sized photograph. Step 3:  Submit the form to the Office of the District Social Welfare Officer concerned. Step 4:  The name of the selected beneficiaries will be made available on the Department's website or displayed on the notice board of the Directorate, Social Welfare/ District Social Welfare Offices.

LIDCOM Training Scheme.details: Being implemented particularly for the (Scheduled Caste) Charmakar Community, the &quot;Training Scheme&quot; is a scheme by the Leather Industries Development Corporation (LIDCOM), Govt. of Maharashtra. This scheme is being implemented for the students to enable them to start their own businesses, trade, or get a job. Only citizens who are permanent residents of the state of Maharashtra are eligible to apply for this scheme. This scheme is completely funded by the Govt. of Maharashtra. The main objective of LIDCOM is to implement various schemes to uplift the lifestyle of Charmakars (Dhor, Chambhar, Holar, Mochi, etc.) who are economically weak and below the poverty line and with an intention to develop them educationally, economically, and socially so as to give them a respectable place in society.
LIDCOM Training Scheme.benefits: This scheme is being implemented for the students to enable them to start their own businesses, trade, or get a job. The training includes: a)  Training Programme for Footwear Designing through Footwear Design & Development Institute (FDDI), Fursatganj, Amethi, Uttar Pradesh. b)  Training Programme for Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) and Maharashtra Public Service Commission (MPSC). c)   Smartness Quotient Booster Training Programme.
LIDCOM Training Scheme.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a citizen of India.
1. The applicant should be a Student.
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Maharashtra State.
1. The applicant should be in the 18 to 50 years age group.
1. The applicant should be from Charmakar Community only (Dhor, Chambhar, Holar, Mochi, etc.).
1. The annual income of the family of the applicant should be less than or equal to ₹1,00,000/-.
1. The applicant should have knowledge of the business for which he has applied for the loan.

application process.process: Step 1:  Take the format of the application form from the  District Office  of LIDCOM. Step 2:  Fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach all the (self-attested) mandatory documents. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Office. Stipend Scheme For Scheduled Tribes - Po.details: The scheme “Stipend Scheme for Scheduled Tribes - Poultry Training Stipend” was launched by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare &amp; Co-operation, Government of Gujarat to raise the income of poultry farmers of Schedule Tribes through scientific poultry farming training. Under this scheme, the beneficiary will be given a maximum ₹2000 (direct in bank account) stipend for six days of training and a poultry training certificate after completion of training.
Stipend Scheme For Scheduled Tribes - Po.benefits:
- The beneficiary will be given maximum ₹2000 (direct in bank account) stipend for six days training. (Considering ₹300/- per day, ₹1800/- for 6 days as daily allowance and ₹200/- as to &amp; fro transport fare with the maximum total stipend ₹2000/-)
- Beneficiary will be given poultry training certificate after completion of training.
Stipend Scheme For Scheduled Tribes - Po.eligibility:
1. The benefits of this scheme will only be given to the adult of Schedule Tribes people of the society of Gujarat State.
1. The beneficiary will have to provide income proof and a caste certificate.
1. Females and beneficiaries Below Poverty Line will be given priority.
