Diwali Gift Benefit Scheme (PBAOCWWB).details: The "Diwali Gift Benefit" is a Welfare Scheme by the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. Through this scheme, the Board sanction sum of ₹ 2,000/- to each beneficiary enrolled in the Board every year to celebrate the Diwali festival. The amount is credited through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) into the bank account of the registered construction worker. The applications are accepted offline.
Diwali Gift Benefit Scheme (PBAOCWWB).benefits: ₹ 2,000/- credited as Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) into the bank account.
Diwali Gift Benefit Scheme (PBAOCWWB).eligibility:
- The applicant should be a citizen of India.
- The Construction Worker should have been registered for at least six months with the 'Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board'.

One Time Cash Incentive towards Learning.details: "One Time Cash Incentive towards Learning Driving" is a Welfare Scheme by the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund of the Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry. Through this scheme, up to ₹4,000/- is provided to the unemployed Ex-servicemen (ESM) to learn to drive. Dr. P. G. Solanki Scheme for Stipend to.details: The scheme “Dr. P. G. Solanki Scheme for Stipend to Scheduled Caste Lawyers” was launched by the Director Scheduled Caste Welfare, Department of Social Justice &amp; Empowerment, Government of Gujarat. The scheme was launched in year 2000. Under the scheme, a monthly stipend is provided for three years to law graduates belonging to the scheduled caste category, as well as to the senior lawyer who trains such individuals. This support is extended due to their poor financial condition, aiming to prevent mid-practice dropout.
Dr. P. G. Solanki Scheme for Stipend to.benefits:
The stipend is given to law graduates for training in practice through senior lawyers as under:

1. ₹1,000/- per month for First Year Training
1. ₹800/- per month for Second Year Training
1. ₹600/- per month for Third Year Training
1. ₹500/- per month as given to Senior Lawyer for giving training
Dr. P. G. Solanki Scheme for Stipend to.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a Law graduate.
   1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste category.
   1. The benefit of this scheme will be given only to natives of Gujarat state.
   1. There is no income limit in this scheme.
   1. The benefit of this scheme will be available to one person only once.

**Note 01:** Application has to be made within two years of registration in Gujarat Bar Council.
**Note 02:** A senior lawyer should have been practicing for at least 10 years.
**Note 03:** A senior lawyer can retain up to two more junior lawyers for training.
**Note 04:** Training to lawyers should be given at the district headquarters. By amending it, this type of training can also be given at the taluka headquarters.
**Note 05:** Trainee junior advocates will have to submit a certificate of training to the senior advocate every month.
**Note 06:** At least 15% of applicants must be from the most marginalized of the scheduled castes.

Himachal Pradesh Patrakar Kalyan Yojana.details: The scheme "Himachal Pradesh Patrakar Kalyan Yojana" was launched by the Director of Information and Public Relations Department, Government of Himachal Pradesh under the Himachal Pradesh Journalists Welfare Fund Scheme, 2006. The purpose of the Yojana shall be to provide financial assistance to the serving accreditated journalists and retired accreditated journalists in adverse situations as accidents and illness etc.
Himachal Pradesh Patrakar Kalyan Yojana.benefits:
**Financial assistance to serving accredited journalist:-** In case of permanent incapacitation for further service while performing field duties as a journalist₹ 1,00,000/-In case of death while performing field Duties₹ 2,00,000/-In case of death during attack or any untoward incidence of violence ₹ 3,00,000/-In case of medical emergency or cancerUpto ₹ 50,000/- (as per emergent need for major disease as kidney transplant, heart disease etc.)
**Financial assistance to retired accredited journalist:** In case of death ₹ 50,000/-In case of medical emergency or cancerUpto ₹ 50,000/- (as per emergent need for major disease as kidney transplant, heart disease etc.)
**Assistance in Adverse Situations:** Financial assistance of ₹25,000/- only as immediate serving accredited journalists and retired accredited journalists or their dependents/legal heirs on production of documentary proof regarding death certificate, illness or accident etc. and subsequently its ex-post-facto approval would be obtained from the Committee.
Himachal Pradesh Patrakar Kalyan Yojana.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a legal heir (spouse, his/her dependent, children) of the deceased journalist. 1. The deceased serving/retired accredited journalist is unmarried or single the financial assistance will be released in favour of his or her dependent father or mother. 1. The medical emergency or any other adverse situation assistance will be released to the serving/retired accredited journalists. 1. The serving/retired accredited journalist's family annual income is less than ₹1,80,000/-. 1. The retired journalist should serve of at least twenty years as accredited journalist with the Government of Himachal Pradesh and not taken other gainful employment besides journalism. 1. The retired accredited journalist's age should be 58 years. **NOTE:** Himachal Pradesh Journalists Welfare Fund Scheme will be replaced by new H.P. Patrakar Kalyan Yojana, 2017 hence who are already subscribers of Himachal Pradesh Journalists Welfare Fund Scheme, 2006 will now be considered as member under this new Scheme.

Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI).details:
The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy launched the "SECI Internship" program under Solar Energy Corporation of India Ltd. The Internship Program will serve as an opportunity for students to gain understanding about Renewable as a sector and SECI as an employer and help them evaluate future career opportunities. The Program will be structured, short-term, supervised placements often focused around particular tasks or projects with defined timescales. The work should be meaningful and must be mutually beneficial for intern and the Corporation.
> **Area of Interest:** - Renewable Energy and Solar-Wind Hybrids. - Floating Solar. - Solar Manufacturing and Battery Energy Storage Systems. - Solar Park development. - Solar Rooftop projects and Off-grid Solar.
> **Duration:** - Engineering/M-Tech students: 3 & 6 months - CA/CA (Inter),CS/ICWA/ICWA(Inter)/CMA students: 6 months to 3 years - MBA students: 7 weeks to 6 months
Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI).benefits:
> **Stipend:** - For training periods less than 6 months: ₹8,000/- per month - For training periods from 6 months to 3 years: ₹12,000/- per month
> **Completion Certificate:** - HR issues a certificate upon successful completion of the internship, confirming attendance and work supervision. **NOTE:** The internship program does not include compensation of any kind, boarding, lodging, transportation etc.
Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI).eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The student should engage in research/pursue Engineering Graduate & Postgraduate Degrees/Ph.D. students in Renewable Energy/CA/CA(Inter)/CS/ICWA/ICWA(Inter)/CMA students/MBA students in HR/Finance/IT/CC from recognized institutions in India or abroad. 1. The applicant must have his own laptop for the internship. 1. The applicant must maintain a regular schedule and demonstrate professionalism. 1. The applicant must sign a non-disclosure agreement to protect SECI's data.
**NOTE:** SECI shall provide them with working space, internet facility, and other necessities as deemed fit by the concerned Heads. However, CA/CA(Inter)/CS/ICWA/ICWA(Inter)CMA/MBA interns may be provided the desktop as per the requirement.

This scheme will be implemented in all the districts of the state.
Mukhyamantri Svadeshi Gau Samvardhan Yoj.benefits:
- Grants covering up to 40% of the total cost per unit (maximum ₹80,000), which includes purchasing cows, transportation, insurance, fodder cutting machine, and shed construction.

**Note 1:** One unit means 02 cows of indigenous improved breed per beneficiary and the unit cost is considered to be approximately 2 lakhs. 
**Note 2:** The grant will be released directly into the bank account of the concerned beneficiary through DBT within a month by the State Program Management Unit.
Mukhyamantri Svadeshi Gau Samvardhan Yoj.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Uttar Pradesh.
1. The age of the applicant should be 18 years or above. 
1. The milk producer/animal rearer should have adequate space/shed available for keeping the animals.
1. The milk producer/animal husbandry should not already have more than 02 cows of indigenous advanced breed like Gir, Sahiwal, Haryana, Tharparkar and F-1 cow of hybrid breed.
1. The applicant should purchase an indigenous improved breed of cows from outside the state. 
1. The applicant should purchase cows of indigenous improved breed of first or second calving.
1. The applicant should purchase disease-free and healthy cows. 
1. The applicant should take animal insurance for all the cows purchased for 03 years. 
1. The applicant should take the transit insurance for the cattle rearer to get for bringing the cows from the place of purchase/state to the place of establishment of the unit.
Mukhyamantri Svadeshi Gau Samvardhan Yoj.exclusions: If the asset is sold or transferred in any other way before three years, the grant will be recovered by the District Executive Committee as per rules.

Gir, Sahiwal, Haryana or Tharparkar cows will be purchased. Step 02:  For identification of cows, ear tagging through microchips/ear tagging system is mandatory. receive any recognition of identity. Step 04:  After purchasing indigenous advanced breed cows from outside states by the beneficiary selected in the first phase, the application will be made again on the prescribed format (Annexure-2) for getting the grant within a maximum of 01 month.

Bihar State Journalist Insurance Scheme.benefits: - Personal accident insurance coverage up to ₹5,00,000/- - Medical expense coverage up to ₹5,00,000/- for the insured and their dependents. **NOTE:** Media representatives contribute 20% of the premium, while the remaining 80% is covered by the government.
Bihar State Journalist Insurance Scheme.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a journalist/media representative. 
1. Independent journalists must hold a valid press accreditation card.
1. The applicant should have a minimum of 5 years of work experience in journalism. 
1. The media representative's age is between 21-70 years. 
1. The media representative should be residing and working in Bihar. 
1. The media representative educational qualification should be matriculation or equivalent for the insurance.
1. The media representative should cover 50% of news or comments in journalists from newspapers, magazines, news agencies, electronic media, and independent journalists with valid press accreditation.
1. The media representative's spouse and two dependent children are included in this Insurance Scheme. 
1. The media representative's son's age is up to 23 years (or 25 if studying any bonafide institutions), and the daughter will be covered until marriage.
1. A media representative affiliated with a private news channel must ensure that the channel's telecast reaches at least 20 districts in the state.
Bihar State Journalist Insurance Scheme.exclusions: The maternity related cases are not covered under mediclaim policy of this insurance scheme.

Chief Minister's Self Employment Scheme.details: The "Chief Minister's Self Employment Scheme" was launched by the Department of Personnel, and Reforms, Training, Public Grievances, Government of Sikkim. The scheme aims to provide loan to unemployed youth who belong below the poverty line. The Chief Minister's Self Employment Scheme shall be a link program for all those unemployed youth who are trained in the Constituency wise Livelihood schools across the State, irrespective of their educational qualification and age to start up self-employment ventures in business, service and industrial activities.
Chief Minister's Self Employment Scheme.benefits:
- Loans up to ₹3,00,000/- per individual. - Loans are interest-free for 2 years, followed by a 6% simple interest rate.
**Note:** In case of the death of a loan recipient, the co-applicant shall be liable for a refund of the outstanding loan. The co-applicant is liable for a refund of only the principal amount to be paid within a period not exceeding one year.
Chief Minister's Self Employment Scheme.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be unemployed. 1. The applicant's age should be between 22 to 35 years. 1. The applicant should have passed the 10th class. 1. The applicant's family annual income should not exceed ₹2,50,000/-. 1. Only one member per family shall be considered for the benefit, except in the case of Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.

Skill Development Training - 15 Days Rec.details:
The "Skill Development Training - 15 Days Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) Training Programme at Work Site" was launched by the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, LET&F (Labour) Department, Telangana. The scheme offers a 15-day Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) training programme for registered construction workers. The programme aims to enhance the employability of workers, ensuring they meet industry standards and are better equipped for future opportunities.
> **Trades Offered:** - Masonry - Bar Bending - Plumbing & Sanitation - Electrical House Wiring - Painting - Welding - Drywall - False Ceiling - Building Carpentry - Formwork Carpentry
Skill Development Training - 15 Days Rec.benefits:
> **Stipend:** - ₹35/- per hour per trainee.
> **Duration:** - 120 hours spread over 15 days.
Skill Development Training - 15 Days Rec.eligibility:
1. The worker must be registered with the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
1. The worker's age should be between 18-45 years old.
1. The worker should have knowledge of Telugu, Hindi, and English language. 
1. The worker should be engaged in the respective trades: Masonry, Bar Bending, Plumbing & Sanitation, Electrical House Wiring, Painting, Welding, Dry wall & False ceiling, Building Carpentry, and Formwork carpentry.

Financial Assistance to Traditional Arti.details: The "Financial Assistance to Traditional Artisans (Panchavrutthi Scheme)" was launched by the Department of Backward Class Welfare, Government of Karnataka, to provide financial assistance to traditional artisans (Panchavrutthi) of the Vishwakarma community in Karnataka. The scheme aims to help these artisans purchase modern tools and upgrade their technological skills to enhance their trade and craftsmanship. The Karnataka Vishwakarma Communities Development Corporation (KVCDC) facilitates this scheme.
Financial Assistance to Traditional Arti.benefits: - **Loan Amount:** Up to ₹80,000/- at an interest rate of 4% per annum.- **Subsidy Amount:** Up to ₹20,000/-.- **Total Assistance:** ₹1,00,000/- (Loan + Subsidy).- **Repayment Period:** The loan is repayable in 34 equal installments over three years, with a grace period of 2 months.
Financial Assistance to Traditional Arti.eligibility:
1. The applicant should belong to the Vishwakarma community.
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Karnataka.
1. The applicant's age should be between 18 to 55 years.
1. The applicant must be engaged in one of the traditional Vishwakarma occupations, including Gold & Silver work, Sculpture, Blacksmith, Woodwork & Handicrafts, or Metallurgy.
1. The applicant or their family members should not have availed of any loan facility from the KVCDC in the previous years.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Karnataka Vishwakarma Communities Development Corporation and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. OR The applicant downloads the  application form  from the official website. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Manager to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Training Centre for Specially-Abled Pers.details:
The Training Centre for Specially-Abled Persons scheme was launched by the Social Welfare & Tribal Affairs Department, Government of Mizoram. Under this scheme, provide vocational courses for specially-abled individuals, funded by the Government of Mizoram. The centers provide courses in tailoring for females and tailoring/shoemaking for males, with a monthly stipend of ₹250 for the training period.
**Training Centers:** There are three training centers, including residential centers in Aizawl for both genders and a non-residential center in Lunglei.
Training Centre for Specially-Abled Pers.benefits:
- One year of vocational training in tailoring and shoemaking.
- A monthly stipend of ₹250/- is given to the trainees.
- Hand sewing machine/Treadle sewing machine/Cobbler tools are given to them upon completion of the course.
Training Centre for Specially-Abled Pers.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Mizoram. 1. The applicant should be a person with a disability. 1. The applicant should be from the Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.

application process.process: Step 1:  The applicant writes the application on plain paper. Step 2:  In the application form attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Self-Certification Scheme.details:
The Labour Department, Government of Tripura, launched the Self-Certification Scheme aims at making the employer or an entrepreneur a conscious and truthful citizen and law-abiding person who is willing to take care of all interests of the workers and employees by following all the Labour laws as applicable and enable the Directorate of Labour to effectively protect the interest of the workers as well as the employers and entrepreneurs and create a friendly and safe environment for the workers and a relationship between the Employer and the Employees.
***Objective:*** The objectives of this Self Certification Scheme is to reduce visits of Government officials for inspection of those units who opt for this Scheme however without compromising on the safety, health, social security and welfare of the workers as provided under the various labour enactments. And also to ensure & enable ease of doing business in the Sate of Tripura.
Self-Certification Scheme.benefits: - Reduces inspection frequency, promoting a business-friendly environment. - Increases transparency and improves employer-employee relations. - Covers a range of labor laws to protect worker welfare. - Reduces administrative burden on the business. - Provides secure, interest-free refund of security after five years if no violations occur.
Self-Certification Scheme.eligibility:
1. All shops, factories, and establishments are eligible to apply. .
1. Not available to units handling hazardous chemicals or substances as per the[ Factories Act, 1948](https://factory.tripura.gov.in/sites/default/files/The%20Factories%20Act1948.pdf) and [Tripura Factories Rules, 2007](https://thc.nic.in/Tripura%20State%20Lagislation%20Rules/Tripura%20Factories%20Rules,%202007.pdf).1. Enrollments must be confirmed with compliance with relevant labor laws.

Saksham Jharkhand Kaushal Vikas Yojana.details: The "Saksham Jharkhand Kaushal Vikas Yojana"  is a component of the umbrella scheme “Mukhymantri Sarthi Yojana” launched by the Department of Labour, Employment, Training and Skill Development, Jharkhand. The scheme aims to create job opportunities for 70% of successful trainees through placement-linked and self-employment training across various sectors. The program operates through 72 training centers and covers trades.
Saksham Jharkhand Kaushal Vikas Yojana.benefits:
Payment terms and schedule are guided by the Common Norms notified by the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship (MSDE). - **Training Cost per Hour:** 1. Category I Sectors/Trades: ₹49/- per hour. 1. Category II Sectors/Trades: ₹42/- per hour. 1. Category III Sectors/Trades: ₹35/- per hour.
- **Boarding and Lodging Costs:** For residential training or trainees who need to travel significant distances 1. X Category Cities: ₹375/- per day per trainee. 1. Y Category Cities: ₹315/- per day per trainee. 1. Z Category Cities: ₹250/- per day per trainee. 1. Rural Areas or Non-Municipal Areas: ₹220/- per day per trainee.
- Placement opportunities for 70% of trainees. - Training in industry-relevant sectors like Tourism & Hospitality, Telecom, Security, Retail, Plumbing, Logistics, IT/ITES, Electronics, Domestic Worker, Construction, Capital Goods, BFSI, Beauty & Wellness, Automotive, Apparel, and Agriculture, Food Processing, Healthcare, Iron & Steel, Mining
Saksham Jharkhand Kaushal Vikas Yojana.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a resident of Jharkhand.
1. The applicant's age should be 18-35 years.
1. The applicant must belong to one of the priority groups (SC/ST, women, PwD, transgender).

application process.process: Candidate registration by TSP: The candidate visits the nearest  Training Service Provide Center  for registration under the "Mukhymantri Sarthi Yojana" umbrella scheme. NOTE:  Candidate registration would be Aadhaar-based & hence Aadhaar number at the time of candidate registration would be mandatory.

Self-Registration by Candidate: Visit the  Jharkhand Skill Development Mission  official website. Click on ‘Candidate Registration’ under the ‘Registration’ tab. Create Profile: Provide basic information such as First Name, Last Name, Username, Password, Identity Type (e.g., Aadhaar), Identity Number, Date of Birth, Gender, Mobile Number, and Email. Submit to receive a User ID and Password via SMS and email. Login and OTP Validation: Log in using the provided Username and Password. Enter the OTP sent to your registered mobile number to activate the User ID. Manage Profile: After login, access the ‘Registration’ link. Update and save user profile details such as Personal information and optional bank account details. Contact and Educational Qualification   Information: Enter and save your contact details, including address and communication preferences. Fill in education details if literate, or select preferred languages if illiterate. Save and submit information to the Training Service Provider (TSP). Registration ID Generation: On final submission, the system generates a unique Registration ID and notifications for successful registration will be sent via SMS and email. NOTE:  Aadhaar number is mandatory for registration and prevents duplicate entries.

Deen Dayal Upadhyay Kaushal Kendra (DDUK.details:
The “Deen Dayal Upadhyay Kaushal Kendra (DDUKK)—Mega Skill Centre” is a component of the umbrella scheme “Mukhymantri Sarthi Yojna” launched by the Department of Labour, Employment, Training and Skill Development, Jharkhand. The scheme, operational since October 2017, focuses on longer-duration courses with on-job training (OJT) for youth. It aims to train 60,000 candidates in various sectors during 2023-24.
**Course Duration** The training under this scheme is a minimum of 576 hours of which 160 hours are dedicated to IT and Soft Skills
Deen Dayal Upadhyay Kaushal Kendra (DDUK.benefits: - **Comprehensive Training:** Combines technical skills with soft skills and IT training.- **Residential Facility:** Training is fully residential, ensuring a focused learning environment.- **On Job Training (OJT):** Hands-on industry exposure for candidates to become job-ready.- **Multi-sector Opportunities:** Tourism & Hospitality, Telecom, Security, Retail, Plumbing, Logistics, IT/ITES, Electronics, Domestic Worker, Construction, Capital Goods, BFSI, Beauty & Wellness, Automotive, Apparel, and Agriculture, Food Processing, Healthcare, Iron & Steel, Mining
Deen Dayal Upadhyay Kaushal Kendra (DDUK.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a resident of Jharkhand.
1. The applicant's age should be 18-35 years.
1. The applicant must belong to one of the priority groups (SC/ST, women, PwD, transgender).

Mahila Swayamsiddha Yojana Rajasthan.details:
The "Mahila Swayamsiddha Yojana" implemented by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Rajasthan, aims to provide skill training and self-employment opportunities to widowed, abandoned, and destitute women. Under this scheme, free vocational training is offered in Nariniketan buildings, operated via voluntary organizations.
> ***Objective:*** - Free vocational training for skill development in various trades. - Accommodation and food provisions for enrolled women and their children. - Financial assistance to NGOs operating training centers. - The training period ranges from 3 months to 1 year. - Assistance in securing employment or availing loans for self-employment. - Monthly stipend for participating women.
> ***Women should belong to one of the following categories:*** - Widowed, abandoned, or destitute women facing social neglect. - Women released from imprisonment without family support. - Women affected by natural disasters, lacking social and financial assistance. - Women rescued from exploitation, trafficking, or forced labor. - Women affected by terrorism or extremist activities. - Women suffering from mental illness, except those requiring institutional psychiatric care. - Women living with HIV/AIDS who are abandoned by their families. - Other women facing extreme social and economic distress.
Mahila Swayamsiddha Yojana Rajasthan.benefits: ***The non-governmental organization provides grant funds by the state government as per the regulations:*** **S.NO.****Details of Position/Expense****Number of Positions****Monthly Expenses****Annual Expenses**1 (A)Doctor (part-time)01₹3,000/-₹36,000/-2 (A)Craft Teacher02₹10,000/-₹1,20,000/-**Total (A)****₹13,000/-****₹1,56,000/-**1 (B)Other Recurring Expenses For the purchase of raw materials (100 rupees per woman per month) 50 for Women**-**₹5,000/-₹60,000/-2 (B)Resident&amp;#39;s food, clerk, cooks, watchman, Class IV employees, cleaning work etc. and newspapers and magazines (Rs 675 per woman per month) for 50 women**-**₹33,750/- ₹4,05,000/- **Total (B)****₹38,750/-****₹4,65,000/-****Total (A+B)****₹51,750/-****₹6,21,000/-**
Mahila Swayamsiddha Yojana Rajasthan.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a registered voluntary organization, trust, or NGO.
1. The organization must be operational for at least three years before applying.
1. The organization should be non-profit and focused on women’s welfare.
1. The organization must have a formally structured administrative and management committee.
1. The organization should not be blacklisted or penalized by any government department.

application process.process: Step 1:  Interested voluntary organizations must submit applications in the prescribed format to the District Collector’s Office. Step 2:  The District Collector’s office reviews and recommends the application. Step 3:  The Social Justice and Empowerment Department evaluates the application. Step 4:  Eligible organizations receive approval and funding. Step 5:  Beneficiary women enroll through the Admission Advisory Committee.

Mukhyamantri Hunar Yojana.details: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Hunar Yojana” was launched by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to enhance employability and self-reliance among minority community individuals by offering free training in various traditional and modern trades.
Mukhyamantri Hunar Yojana.benefits: Under this scheme, free training is provided along with an honorarium during the training period. The honorarium is paid as follows: - ₹2,000/- for 100 hours of training, - ₹2,500/- for 150 hours of training, - ₹4,000/- for 250 hours of training, - ₹4,500/- for 300 hours of training, The training is conducted through implementing agencies, and the honorarium is disbursed based on attendance. A minimum of 90% attendance is mandatory.
Mukhyamantri Hunar Yojana.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a man or woman belonging to a minority community (Muslim, Sikh, Christian, Parsi, Buddhist, or Jain). 1. The age of the applicant should be between 18 and 45 years. 1. The applicant must have completed education either from a Government school or from a Madrasa. 1. For traditional training courses such as sewing, embroidery, plumbing, electronics, knitting, etc., the applicant must be at least Class 5 pass or literate. 1. For Information Technology courses (Computer Hardware, Software, Networking, Accounting, etc.), the applicant must have passed at least High School. 1. The annual family income should not exceed ₹3,50,000/- in rural areas and ₹4,50,000/- in urban areas.

application process.process: Under this scheme, training is provided through voluntary organizations. The Minority Welfare Department publishes advertisements inviting applications for training, after which interested candidates can obtain the application form from the Minority Welfare Office. The completed application form must be submitted to the office along with Aadhaar card, permanent residence certificate, minority certificate, income certificate, and educational qualification certificate. Applicants are then called for an interview by the selection committee constituted at the district level under the chairmanship of the District Minority Welfare Officer or the District Social Welfare Officer, who also serves as the ex-officio District Manager. At the time of the interview, candidates are required to present the original copies of all their documents for verification. After selection, the training is provided by the designated institute. Training programs are organized every year, and applicants may also submit their forms to the Minority Welfare Office in advance, even before the advertisement, so that their applications can be considered when the training sessions commence.

Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Profess.details:
The &quot;Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana - Professional/Technical Training&quot; scheme was launched by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Rajasthan, with the objective of providing vocational and technical skill development training to beneficiary boys and girls under the State Government’s Palanhar Scheme, to make them self-reliant. The scheme aims to make every possible effort to provide employment opportunities and a respectable livelihood to these beneficiaries after the completion of their training.
Under this scheme, vocational/technical training is provided to Palanhar beneficiary boys and girls through recognized training providers such as the Rajasthan Skill and Livelihood Development Corporation (RSLDC), Rajasthan Knowledge Corporation Limited (RKCL), Jan Shikshan Sansthan, or industrial training institutes recognized by the State or Central Government.
The scheme is implemented by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Rajasthan, at the state level and by the Deputy Director/Assistant Director, Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, at the district level.
Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Profess.benefits:
***Professional/Technical Training Benefits:***

  - Vocational/technical training will be provided to Palanhar beneficiary boys/girls through recognized training providers by the Rajasthan Skill and Livelihood Development Corporation / Rajasthan Knowledge Corporation Limited (RKCL) / Jan Shikshan Sansthan / industrial training institutes recognized by the state government/central government.
  - The State Government will reimburse the prescribed fees and other expenses to the training provider institute for the related program. 
  - If the boy/girl wants to avail hostel or any other prescribed facility/fee (mess fee, stationery and dress fee) of the concerned institute, then that will also be reimbursed.
  - A maximum of 2 training programmes can be availed under this scheme, provided the beneficiary is below 21 years of age or till the completion of the respective course.
  - The boy / girl receiving training under the scheme will be given a training certificate by the concerned institute / training provider.

**Note:** Fees and other expenses will be provided directly to the concerned training institute after admission of the boy / girl in the respective programme.
Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Profess.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a beneficiary under the Palanhar Scheme of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should have completed 15 years of age.
1. The applicant’s maximum age should not exceed 21 years, or till course completion (whichever is earlier).

application process.process: Application Process: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to contact their recognized training institution. Step 1:  The interested applicant downloads the  application form  from the official website. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the recognized training institution. Step 4:  The recognized training institution forwards the student's application to the District Officer, Social Justice and Empowerment Department, with the training program details. Post-Application Process: Step 1:  Verification and approval are to be completed within one month. Step 2:  Fees and additional costs will be reimbursed directly to the institution.

Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Higher.details:
The &quot;Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana – Higher Education/Technical Education&quot; was launched by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Rajasthan, with the objective of providing technical or higher education to beneficiary boys and girls under the State Government’s Palanhar Scheme, to help them become self-reliant. The scheme aims to make every possible effort to ensure employment opportunities and a dignified livelihood for these beneficiaries upon completion of their higher or technical education.
Under this scheme, the State Government provides financial assistance to eligible boys and girls enrolled under the Palanhar Scheme to pursue higher or technical education, based on their qualifications and interest in employment-oriented courses.
The scheme is implemented by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Rajasthan, at the state level and by the Deputy Director/Assistant Director, Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, at the district level.
Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Higher.benefits:
> **Higher Education /Technical Education Benefits:**


- Financial assistance for career-oriented higher or technical education (graduation/post-graduation courses). 

> **Mode of Disbursement:**


- Reimbursement of the actual course fee through bank account transfer.
Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Higher.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a beneficiary under the Palanhar Scheme of Rajasthan.
   1. The applicant should have completed 15 years of age.
   1. The applicant’s maximum age should not exceed 21 years or till course completion (whichever is earlier).
   1. The applicant should be pursuing education from a university/college/technical educational institution recognized by the Government of India/State Government.
   1. Financial assistance is applicable for regular higher or technical education at the graduate or postgraduate level.
   1. The applicant should not be receiving any scholarships or grants for higher/technical education from the Central or State Government.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  The interested applicant downloads the  application form  from the official website. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Deputy Director/Assistant Director, Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, at the district level. Step 4:  After verification, course fees will be reimbursed to the student’s bank account. Note:  Apply for fee reimbursement within 3 months of admission.

Green Skill Development Programme (GSDP).details: The scheme "Harit Kaushal Vikas Karyakram" implemented by the Govind Ballabh Pant National Institute of Himalayan Environment (NIHE), aims to promote sustainable and eco-friendly livelihoods through nature-based skill development. Through this scheme, free skill training is provided to farmers, students, and youth to support self-employment and prepare them for government-backed programs as master trainers. It covers subjects like ornithology, wildlife conservation, natural interpretation, and biodiversity communication. The program is aligned with the Green Skill Development Program (GSDP) and is accessible through online applications via the official portal.
Green Skill Development Programme (GSDP).benefits: - **Skill Development Training:** Free-of-cost training in environment-related fields such as bird identification, wildlife conservation, biodiversity interpretation, and eco-tourism education.  - **Self-Employment Opportunities:** Empowers youth and farmers to pursue independent livelihood avenues through knowledge-based interventions.  - **Government Scheme Readiness:** Makes candidates eligible for roles under various central/state schemes and government-supported training projects.
Green Skill Development Programme (GSDP).eligibility:
- The applicant should be a student.
  - The applicant should have completed at least 10th standard.
  - The applicant should be a farmer/ youth or individual seeking self-employment.
  - The applicant should be below 55 years of age at the time of application.
  - The applicant should have an interest in environmental and ecological training topics such as wildlife, biodiversity, or natural resource interpretation.

application process.process: Step 1:  The applicant can download the prescribed  application form  or can request it from the Govind Ballabh Pant National Institute of Himalayan Environment (NIHE). Step 2:  The applicant must carefully fill out all details in the application form, including personal details, educational qualifications, address, preferred training course, and declaration. Step 3:  The applicant should affix a recent passport-size photograph on the form and attach self-attested copies of the required documents. Step 4:  The completed application form along with the required documents can be submitted offline in the concerned Institution or through can be send through the following mail ids: gbpihed@envis.nic.in maheshlyf87@gmail.com deepudun28@gmail.com Contact Us: Public Information Officer Dr. S.C. Arya G.B. Pant National Institute of Himalayan Environment Kosi-Katarmal, Almora-263 643, Uttarakhand, India (Code: +91-5962) 241041, 241154 Extn: 70 Fax: (05962) 241014, 241150 scarya2009@gmail.com

Skill Development.details: The scheme "Skill Development" implemented by the Wadia Institute of Himalayan Geology aims to enhance the practical knowledge and research capabilities of students pursuing Earth Science and allied subjects. Through this scheme, specialised summer and winter training programmes are offered to postgraduate and integrated postgraduate students in disciplines such as geochemistry, sedimentology, tectonics, geomorphology, environmental geoscience, and paleontology.
Skill Development.benefits: - **Research Experience:** Provides opportunities for self-sponsored research work, allowing students to gain practical experience in Earth Sciences.  - **Seasonal Training:** Offers valuable summer and winter training programs, enhancing practical skills and knowledge in specialized geological disciplines.  - **Exposure to Diverse Fields:** Exposes students to a wide array of sub-disciplines within Earth Sciences, such as structural geology, geochemistry, glaciology, engineering geology, palaeontology, and environmental geology.
Skill Development.eligibility:
1. The applicant must possess a postgraduate degree in any discipline of Geosciences, Earth Sciences, or allied fields.
   1. The applicant may also be pursuing an integrated postgraduate degree course and should be in the fourth or fifth year of the curriculum.
   1. The applicant must be from fields such as geophysics, geochemistry, structural geology, sedimentology, paleontology, environmental geoscience, and related disciplines.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the official website of WIHG at  https://www.wihg.res.in./ . Step 2:  Look for announcements or notifications regarding the Kaushal Vikas (Skill Development) programme. Step 3:  Download or access the application form or online registration link. Step 4:  Fill out the form with all required personal, academic, and institutional details. Step 5:  Upload or attach the required documents as specified in the guidelines. Step 6:  Submit the application as per instructions.

Self-Employment loan scheme for Minorit.details: The scheme "Self-Employment loan scheme for Minority Widows, Divorcees / Abandoned Women" was introduced by the State Minority Welfare Department, Government of Kerala. The scheme aims to provide self-employment loans to women from minority communities. Through this scheme, government financial assistance with a 20% subsidy is provided to widows, divorced women, and abandoned women from minority communities. The scheme is implemented by the Kerala State Minority Development Finance Corporation.
Self-Employment loan scheme for Minorit.benefits:
- Financial assistance of up to ₹1,00,000/- as a government subsidy. - Maximum loan amount of ₹5,00,000/-. - The interest rate on the loan amount (excluding subsidy) is 6%.
> **Conditions/Criteria Associated with Benefits:** A 20% subsidy (maximum ₹1,00,000/-) is provided on the loan amount. - For a loan amount of ₹1,00,000/-, the subsidy is ₹20,000/-. - For a loan amount of ₹2,00,000/-, the subsidy is ₹40,000/-. - For a loan amount of ₹3,00,000/-, the subsidy is ₹60,000/-. - For a loan amount of ₹4,00,000/-, the subsidy is ₹80,000. - For a loan amount of ₹5,00,000/-, the subsidy is ₹1,00,000/-. _*At each stage of disbursement, photos and bills must be submitted._ _*Direct inspection will be conducted at each stage of disbursement._ _*An additional interest of 6% will be charged for misuse of funds._
Self-Employment loan scheme for Minorit.eligibility: - The applicant must belong to a minority community (Muslim, Christian, Buddhist, Sikh, Parsi, Jain). - The applicant should be a widow, divorced woman, or abandoned woman. - The applicant's age should be between 20 and 60 years. - The applicant's family's annual income should not exceed ₹2,50,000/-. > **Preference/Priority** - Priority will be given to mothers of children below 18 years of age. - Priority will be given to widows from families identified through the extreme poverty identification survey.
Self-Employment loan scheme for Minorit.exclusions: - The following types of land are not accepted as collateral: Kuzhikanam, Verumpattom, Devaswam Verumpattom, pledged land, and agricultural fields (if patta is not received). - Residential land less than 4 cents will not be accepted as collateral.

application process.process: Step 1:   Visit the  official website  of the Directorate of Minority Affairs and check on "News & Updates". Select the "Self-Employment loan scheme for Minority Widows, Divorcees / Abandoned Women" and obtain the application form. Alternatively, you can also visit the  official website of KSMDFC and go to the "Application Form" section and select the " Application Form for Widows' Loan Subsidy" . Take a printout and fill out the  application form . Step 2:   Attach the required copies of documents (Income Certificate, Caste/Age Certificate, Certificate proving applicant is a widow/divorced/abandoned woman) for primary verification. Step 3:   Submit the filled application form, either directly or by post, to the respective Regional Office of the Kerala State Minority Development Finance Corporation in your district. *Attend the interview, bringing all original documents mentioned in the "Documents Required - For Interview" section. *If the loan is approved, submit the additional required documents as per the chosen guarantee type (officer guarantee or property guarantee). *The loan will be sanctioned as per the Corporation's rules and government regulations

CM's Jibon Anuprerana Scheme.details: The scheme "CM's Jibon Anuprerana Scheme" by the Skill, Employment & Entrepreneurship Department, Government of Assam aims to provide one-time financial assistance to eligible full-time research scholars and full-time Divyang (differently-abled) research scholars from public institutions in Assam, thereby promoting academic excellence and innovation in Assam. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹25,000/- for research scholars and ₹40,000/- for Divyang research scholars as a one-time benefit during their scholastic journey. To be eligible, the applicant must be a permanent resident of Assam and must be admitted to PhD program in 2025 at Central or State Universities in Assam. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Employment and Craftsmen Training through the Directorate of Investment and Development of Skill Portal. The applications for this scheme are accepted online.
CM's Jibon Anuprerana Scheme.benefits: **For Research Scholars:** One-time Financial Assistance of ₹25,000/-. **For Divyang Research Scholars:** One-time Financial Assistance of ₹40,000/-. **Mode of Disbursement:** Direct Benefit Transfer to eligible scholars.
CM's Jibon Anuprerana Scheme.eligibility: - The applicant must be a Full-time Research Scholar or Full-time Divyang Research Scholar from Government or Public institutions of the state or central, situated in Assam. - The applicant must be a permanent resident of Assam. - The applicant must be admitted to a PhD program in 2025 at Central or State Universities in Assam.

application process.process: Step 1:   Access the Directorate of Investment and Development of Skill Portal Visit the  official portal of the Directorate of Investment and Development of Skills (DIDS). Navigate to the CM's Jibon Anuprerana Scheme section. Step 2:   Submit Application Online Fill in all required personal details including name, contact details, and identity proof information. Enter institution details and enrollment number. Upload proof of PhD admission. Submit self-declaration and exclusion compliance documents. Upload all required supporting documents in the specified format. Step 3:   Institutional Verification The concerned institution's designated verifier (Registrar, Principal, or Vice Chancellor) will access the Visit the  official portal of the Directorate of Investment and Development of Skills (DIDS). Institution will verify applicant information including name, proof of identity, contact details, institution details, enrollment number, proof of PhD admission, and self-declaration compliance. Institution will mark verification status as either Accept (verified and eligible) or Reject (ineligible or non-compliant) with specific remarks. Institution will forward verified applications to Directorate of Employment and Craftsmen Training within 7 working days. Step 4:   Scrutiny by Directorate of Employment and Craftsmen Training Directorate of Employment and Craftsmen Training will conduct scrutiny of verified applications. Bulk forwarding of eligible applications for final processing. Step 5:   Preparation of Final Beneficiary List Final list of eligible beneficiaries will be prepared after complete scrutiny. Step 6:   Direct Benefit Transfer Disbursement Eligible scholars will receive financial assistance through Direct Benefit Transfer to their bank accounts. Help & Support / Grievance Redressal Email: infochiefministersscheme@gmail.com; Phone: 8099897266 Timelines Verification by Institution: Within 5 working days of application submission Final Forwarding by Institution: Within 7 working days

Vocational Education Programme.details: The “Vocational Education Programme” is a scheme under the Samagra Shiksha Programme, implemented by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to impart vocational education alongside academic learning to students of classes 9 to 12 in selected government secondary schools.
Vocational Education Programme.benefits: Under the programme, 08 sectors approved by the Government of India are being implemented under NSQF to provide vocational education alongside academic education for students of classes 9 to 12 in selected schools, where they receive both vocational education and training.
Vocational Education Programme.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be studying in classes 9 to 12 in one of the 200 selected government secondary schools of Uttarakhand.

application process.process: All students studying in classes 9 to 12 in government secondary schools where vocational education is conducted can take admission in the sectors operated under this programme. If a student from another school wishes to study the vocational education curriculum, they must take admission in a school where the vocational education curriculum is being conducted. Students already studying in such schools can choose vocational education as one of their subjects like other subjects. For this, no separate application is required. There is also no need to submit any documents for the selection of vocational education subject.

Loan For Commercial Pilot Training.details: The "Loan For Commercial Pilot Training" scheme was launched by the Tribal Development Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to support Scheduled Tribe (ST) students in pursuing professional pilot training by providing affordable loans. Under this scheme, tribal students can avail a loan at a concessional interest rate, enabling them to secure high-quality training and good employment opportunities.
Loan For Commercial Pilot Training.benefits: **Monetary Benefit** - Loan of up to ₹25,00,000 or the actual cost of training, whichever is lower. **Interest Rate** - 4% per annum. **Penalty Interest** - 2.5% per annum on delayed repayments. **Beneficiary Contribution** - No contribution is required from the applicant. **Repayment Terms** - Repayment begins 1 year after the loan disbursement date. - Repayment period is 144 monthly installments (12 years). - Includes 10 years for principal repayment and 2 years for interest repayment. - Early repayment is permitted.
Loan For Commercial Pilot Training.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category. 1. The applicant must have passed Matriculation, Higher Secondary, Indian School Certificate, or an equivalent examination. 1. The applicant must have secured admission to a recognized commercial pilot training institute. 1. The applicant should have passed Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC).

application process.process: Registration Process Visit the Gujarat Tribal Development Corporation  official website . Click on the " APPLY FOR LOAN ". Select the scheme name "Foreign Study". Fill the registration form: Full Name (as per Aadhaar Card), Gender, Date of Birth, Aadhaar Number, Mobile Number, Uder name, Password for login, Confirm Password. Click on the "Sign Up. After successful registration, User ID and Password will be generated. Application Process Enter User ID, Password, and Captcha Code. After login, schemes applicable to your caste will be displayed. Click on the scheme you want to apply for. Fill the "Application Form" and upload the required documents Click Save Application. The system will generate an Application Number. Click Print Application.

Project Sankalp.details: The scheme "Project Sankalp" was launched on 15th July 2020 by the Gujarat Skill Development Mission (GSDM), Labour and Employment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to revolutionize vocational skilling, making India the global skill capital with globally competitive skills and competencies. The scheme provides an industry-led vocational skilling program, enabling the industry to fulfill its demand for skilled manpower and providing youth with sustainable employment opportunities. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Skill Development Mission. The applications for this scheme are accepted online through the GSDM portal.
Project Sankalp.benefits: > **Training Cost Reimbursement** The Industry Partner will receive reimbursement for training costs per candidate per hour: - NSQF Category 1 Job Roles: ₹49. - NSQF Category 2 Job Roles: ₹42. - NSQF Category 3 Job Roles: ₹35.10. - GCVT Job Roles and Company-Specific Job Roles: ₹36.75 (which is 75% of the Category 1 NSQF job role training cost). _*The training cost for NSQF Job Roles is subject to amendments as per MSDE notification, and the cost for GCVT and Company-specific job roles will also change accordingly._ > ***Assessment Cost Reimbursement*** GSDM will reimburse the assessment cost directly to the respective Sector Skill Council (SSC), Gujarat Council of Vocational Training (GCVT), or Kaushalya Skill University (KSU) for both fresher trainees and existing employees. _*Any re-assessment cost for candidates who were absent or failed the first assessment, or for existing workers/employees, must be borne by the Industry Partner._ > ***No Training Fee for Youth/Beneficiaries*** No fee of any kind will be charged from the youth or beneficiaries for the training.
Project Sankalp.eligibility: - The Fresher Trainees must have a domicile of Gujarat. - The age of Fresher Trainees must be between 18 and 35 years. - The Existing Employees could be from Pan-India. - The age of Existing Employees must be between 18 and 55 years. > **Relaxations & Preferences** - The scheme focuses on the inclusion of Special Groups such as Women, Persons with Disability (PwD), Below Poverty Line (BPL), Scheduled Caste (SC), and Scheduled Tribe (ST). - A relaxation of ten years may be given to Women, PwD, BPL, SC, and ST candidates for fresher trainees.

application process.process: Step 1:   Access the GSDM Portal & Initiate Registration To begin, the applicant should visit the  Skills Gujarat portal . On the displayed login screen, the applicant must locate and click on the " Register ". This action will prompt the system to initiate the candidate registration process, allowing new users to create an account. Step 2:   Complete Basic Registration Details The applicant will be required to provide all the mandatory details in the registration form. The system will generate One Time Passwords (OTPs), which will be sent to both the registered email ID and the mobile number provided by the applicant. A verification screen will appear, where the applicant must accurately enter the "Email OTP" and "Mobile OTP" received. Step 3:   Confirm Verification and Receive Login Credentials After entering both OTPs, the applicant should click the "Verify & Save" button. If the OTPs are successfully verified, a confirmation message will appear, indicating successful basic registration. Subsequently, the "User Name" and "Password" for the account will be generated and shared with the applicant via their registered email ID and mobile number. Step 4:   Initial Login and Password Creation Using the newly received "Username" and "Password," along with the Captcha displayed on the login screen, the applicant should log in to their account. For security purposes, the system will then prompt the applicant to create a new password by entering a "New Password" and re-entering it in the "Enter Confirm Password" field, followed by another Captcha. The applicant must click "Submit" to finalize the new password. Step 5:   Complete Full Registration Once logged in with the new password, the applicant will proceed to the Full Registration section. Here, they must provide all the mandatory details and upload the mandatory documents in the specified format and size. The applicant must carefully read and then click "I Agree to the Terms and Conditions" to confirm the correctness of all the information updated during the registration process. Finally, they should click "Save and Continue" to submit their complete registration details. Step 6:   Access Candidate Dashboard and Utilize Resources Upon successful full registration, the applicant will be directed to their Candidate Dashboard. From this dashboard, they can access various features, including the "TC Locator / KVK Locator" to search for the Nearest Krishi Vigyan Kendra (KVK) or Training Center. Additionally, they can click on "Interest Assessment Test," which redirects them to http://gujarati.careerguide.com/my-profile, to start and view their psychometric test report. *No fee of any kind should be charged from the youth or beneficiary for the Project Sankalp training.

Dastkar Prashikshan (I.T.I).details: The “Dastkar Prashikshan” scheme was launched by the Department of Skill Development and Employment, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide benefits to the youth of the state by connecting them with private-sector employment or self-employment opportunities through skills training offered at district ITIs.
Dastkar Prashikshan (I.T.I).benefits: - To benefit the youth by connecting them with employment or self-employment opportunities in the private sector through skill training provided by district ITIs. - The duration of this training is either 1 year or 2 years.
Dastkar Prashikshan (I.T.I).eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must have passed Class 8 or Class 10. 1. The fee is currently fixed at ₹4,000/- per annum.

application process.process: The department announces the ITI admission process through advertisements. Admissions are conducted between July and September each year. Applications can be submitted through the website  www.vpputtarakhand.in . Applicants must provide an Aadhaar card, all applicable reservation certificates, a permanent residence certificate, a bank account number, and a mobile number. Admission is finally granted after an online counseling process based on merit.

Training Program for A-HELP Women Worker.details: The scheme “Training Program for A-HELP Women Workers” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Livestock Development Board (ULDB) under the Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide community-service-based skill development and employment opportunities for women in the field of animal husbandry.
Training Program for A-HELP Women Worker.benefits: Under this scheme, community-service-based job creation or job filling is carried out between the Animal Husbandry Department and Animal Husbandry by A-HELP workers.
Training Program for A-HELP Women Worker.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a woman member of a self-help group formed under the Uttarakhand State Rural Livelihood Mission. 1. The applicant must have a minimum educational qualification of eighth pass. 1. The applicant must have completed 7 days of Pashu Sakhi training.

application process.process: Eligible women selected by the Uttarakhand State Rural Livelihood Mission may apply.

High Altitude Guide Course.details: The scheme “High Altitude Guide Course” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Tourism Development Board under the Department of Tourism, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to train and certify youth of Uttarakhand as professional high-altitude guides who have already completed a Low Altitude Guide Course from a recognized institution.
High Altitude Guide Course.benefits: The beneficiary will become a certified high-altitude guide upon completing the course.
High Altitude Guide Course.eligibility: - The applicant must be a youth from Uttarakhand. - The applicant must have completed a Low Altitude Guide Course from a recognized institution. > The total number of 41 beneficiaries will be selected.

application process.process: Applicants must complete the prescribed application form and submit it along with the required documents to the office of the District Tourism Development Officer. Upon completion of the tests, the District Tourism Development Officer will forward the list of shortlisted candidates to the headquarters. Final selection of participants will be made by a committee constituted at the headquarters.

Tribals Development Plan: Purchase of To.details: The “Purchase of Tourist Taxi” component forms part of the umbrella scheme “Tribals Development Plan”, launched by the Directorate of Social Welfare, Government of Goa. This sub-scheme aims to empower Scheduled Tribe (ST) families by providing financial assistance to purchase tourist taxis for self-employment in Goa’s growing tourism industry. It supports tribal households in transitioning from traditional occupations to sustainable livelihood opportunities through the transport sector. Eligible beneficiaries receive a subsidy of ₹15,000/- from the Directorate of Social Welfare (DSW) in addition to any applicable assistance under the Central Government’s Swarnajayanti Gram Swarozgar Yojana (SGSY). The component is implemented through the District Rural Development Agencies (DRDAs) and the Directorate of Social Welfare, and applications are accepted offline at district and taluka-level offices.
Tribals Development Plan: Purchase of To.benefits: - **For BPL families:** A total subsidy of ₹25,000/-, comprising ₹10,000/- from the District Rural Development Agency (DRDA) under the Swarnajayanti Gram Swarozgar Yojana (SGSY) and ₹15,000/- from the Directorate of Social Welfare (DSW).- **For non-BPL tribal families** (with annual income < ₹1,20,000/-): A subsidy of ₹15,000/- from DSW.- The subsidy is a one-time financial assistance towards the cost of purchasing a tourist taxi for livelihood use. - **Target Beneficiaries per Year:** 50 tribal households. _*The vehicle must be registered and operated as a tourist taxi under applicable transport regulations._ _*The vehicle must be used solely for livelihood/self-employment by the beneficiary._ _*The subsidy is non-recurring and can be availed only once per household._ _*Misuse or transfer of vehicle ownership within the benefit period may lead to withdrawal or recall of the assistance._
Tribals Development Plan: Purchase of To.eligibility: - The applicant must belong to one of the Scheduled Tribe (ST) communities of Goa—Gawda, Velip, or Kunbi. - The applicant must be a resident of Goa. - The applicant’s annual family income must be less than ₹1,20,000/-. - The applicant must be part of a tribal household identified under the Tribals Development Plan. - The applicant’s family must fall under either: (a) the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category, or (b) the non-BPL category with annual income < ₹1,20,000/-. - The applicant must intend to use the vehicle for self-employment in the tourism/transport sector. - The applicant must possess or obtain a valid driving licence and vehicle registration documents prior to benefit disbursal.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit the Office of the Directorate of Social Welfare, Government of Goa, or the District Rural Development Agency (DRDA), request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form of the scheme from the staff. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Block Development Officer (BDO) or District Welfare Office. Post-Application Processes Step 1:  The Directorate of Social Welfare verifies eligibility, income, and caste status. The DRDA cross-checks details with the BPL list and prepares the list of shortlisted beneficiaries. Step 2:  Upon approval, the Directorate of Social Welfare releases the subsidy amount directly to the approved beneficiary through the designated bank account. Step 3:  Random field verification is conducted to ensure the motorcycle has been purchased and is used for the intended self-employment purpose.

Training Classes In Veda/Devaram.details: The scheme "Training Classes in Veda/Devaram" was launched by the Hindu Religious Institutions and Wakf Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. The scheme offers specialized training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham. These subjects are required for divine worship/Poojas. The classes are conducted in various Saivaite and Vainavaite temples in the Puducherry region to provide instruction to eligible candidates. The instructing pandits (teachers) are provided an honorarium of ₹1,000/- per month. Applications are collected by receiving them from some of the important temples of the Puducherry region.
Training Classes In Veda/Devaram.benefits: - Provision of training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham, which are required for divine worship/Poojas. - Instructing pandits are provided an honorarium of ₹1,000/- per month. - The honorarium is given once every three months. - The honorarium is disbursed upon the pandits furnishing attendance particulars of the students who attended the Veda classes.
Training Classes In Veda/Devaram.eligibility: - The applicant must be an eligible candidate to receive the training. - The applicant must be a resident of Puducherry. - The applicant must know how to read, write, and speak Tamil fluently. - The applicant must be interested in receiving specialized training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format of the application form . Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form, along with the documents, to the concerned authority at the temple. *The processing time for the application shall be 15 days.

Deen Dayal Antyodaya Yojana - National U.details: The "Self-Employment Programme" is an initiative under the Deen Dayal Antyodaya Yojana – National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NULM), implemented by the Nagar Nigam Dehradun under the Department of Urban Development, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sustainable livelihoods and economic empowerment of the urban poor by providing financial support and guidance for establishing self-employment ventures, strengthening their family’s economy, and generating new employment opportunities.
Deen Dayal Antyodaya Yojana - National U.benefits: - **Under the Self-Employment Programme**, the beneficiary in urban areas enhances their livelihood while strengthening their own and their family’s economic condition. - **Under the Self-Employment Programme**, the beneficiary is provided a loan of up to ₹2.00 lakh through the bank. - There is a provision for interest subsidy under the **Self-Employment Programme**, where 7% of the interest is borne by the beneficiary and the remaining is shared by the Government of India and the State Government. - **Under the Self-Employment Programme**, the beneficiary can generate new employment and also expand existing employment opportunities.
Deen Dayal Antyodaya Yojana - National U.eligibility: 1. The beneficiary must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The beneficiary is eligible for this scheme under the municipal body area. 1. The annual income of the beneficiary's family must be less than ₹3.00 lakh, as per the standards of the Government of India.

application process.process: Under the Self-Employment Programme, the application form must be obtained from the municipal body. The beneficiary must attach the following with the application form: Aadhaar card, income certificate or a self-declared ₹10/- affidavit (stating that no loan has been taken earlier from any bank), a project report of the activities to be undertaken by the beneficiary with an estimated cost of up to ₹2.00 lakh, one passport-size photograph, address proof such as a ration card or electricity bill, bank passbook, and photocopies of all the above documents. The completed application form along with these documents must be submitted to the municipal body. The application process at the municipal level is free of charge. At the municipal level, the applications under the Self-Employment Programme are scrutinized. The loan application form under the Self-Employment Programme is presented before a task force committee constituted by the municipal body. The task force examines the application form by reviewing the documents attached by the beneficiary and interacting with the beneficiary. After this process, the beneficiary’s loan application form is sent by the municipal body to the concerned bank.

Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme.details: The "Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Scheduled Tribe)" scheme was launched by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to promote sustainable self-employment and income generation among Scheduled Tribe individuals by supporting viable livelihood projects. Under this scheme, financial assistance, including a bank loan is provided to the beneficiaries for setting up income-generating units with a total project cost between ₹50,000 and ₹2,00,000.
Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme.benefits: > **Financial Assistance:** - Project Cost: Between ₹50,000/- and ₹2,00,000/-. - Bank Loan: 60% of the project cost - Margin Money: 30% of the project cost, repayable at 7% annual interest in 60 monthly installments - Grant: Up to ₹50,000/-. > **Beneficiary Contribution:** - No contribution for project cost up to ₹1,00,000/- - 10% contribution for project cost between ₹1,01,000/- and ₹2,00,000/-
Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category.
1. The applicant's age must be between 18 and 50 years.
1. The applicant’s annual family income should not exceed ₹2,50,000/-.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  The interested applicant downloads the  application form   from the official website. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the office of the Vikas Khand (Block Development) Office. Selection Process: Step 1:  The application will be forwarded to the District Social Welfare Officer. Step 2:  A District-Level Committee, headed by the District Social Welfare Officer, will review the proposals and select beneficiaries.

Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons.details: The scheme “Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons in State Services” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide job opportunities to medal-winning sportspersons of Uttarakhand, who have represented the state in international and national games, by offering them out-of-turn employment in various state services.
Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons.benefits: Under this scheme, medal-winning players from Uttarakhand who have represented the state in International or National Games are provided out-of-turn employment on Gazetted and Non-Gazetted posts (from Level-3 to Level-10) across various government departments.
Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons.eligibility: 1. State players/sportspersons who have won gold, silver, or bronze medals in international or national games, such as the Olympic/Paralympic Games, World Cup/World Championship, Asian Games, Commonwealth Games, Asian Championship, Commonwealth Championship, SAF Games, and National Games, are eligible under the scheme. 1. Players/sportspersons participating in any of the following sports will be considered eligible: Athletics, Archery, Badminton, Basketball, Boxing, Canoeing & Kayaking, Cycling, Diving, Equestrian, Fencing, Football, Golf, Handball, Hockey, Judo, Lawn Tennis, Shooting, Rowing, Sailing, Swimming, Table Tennis, Taekwondo, Volleyball, Weightlifting, Wrestling, Baseball, Chess, Cricket, Kabaddi, Karate, Kho-Kho, and Mallakhamb. 1. The player/sportsperson must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The player/sportsperson must have represented the state of Uttarakhand in the National Games in the year and competition for which they are applying for employment.

application process.process: As outlined in Government Order No. 728/VI-3/2023-33(7)2014, dated 14.09.2023, the Sports Directorate will receive vacancy details from the relevant departments and publish advertisements in newspapers to recruit eligible athletes. Upon receiving applications directly from the Director, Sports Directorate, the committee will review the applications and submit its recommendations within two months. The Sports Department will forward the committee’s recommendations to the respective departments. Selected medal-winning athletes will be appointed to supernumerary positions by the relevant department within four months. For employment, athletes must possess the minimum educational qualifications required for the position. However, the committee may consider granting exemptions or relaxations for medal-winning athletes regarding mandatory or preferred qualifications. If a medal winner does not possess the required educational qualifications at the time of appointment, the department will allow the athlete up to four years to acquire the necessary qualifications. Medal-winning athletes must submit their applications to the sports offices within two years (for seniors) and three years (for juniors) after achieving their success. Applications must include the completed form along with the medal-winning certificates, Aadhaar card, and permanent residence certificate. Medal-winning athletes from 10 years ago and 5 years ago will be eligible to apply within 12 months from the date of issuance of this Government Order.

Sponsorship for Employment.details: The scheme "Sponsorship for Employment" is implemented by Uttarakhand Purv Sainik Kalyan Nigam Limited (UPNL) under the Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide employment opportunities to ex-servicemen and their legal dependents by sponsoring them for contractual posts. Under this scheme, eligible candidates are sponsored for various departmental positions based on demand and their qualifications.
Sponsorship for Employment.benefits: Under this scheme, employment opportunities are provided to ex-servicemen and their legal dependents by sponsoring them for contractual posts through outsourcing.
Sponsorship for Employment.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be an ex-serviceman (Army, Navy, or Air Force), their legal dependent, or a widow of an ex-serviceman (Veer Nari).

application process.process: Firstly, the eligible candidates (ex-servicemen and their legal dependents) fill out the online application/enrollment form for the desired post on the UPNL website:  www.upnl.co.in , based on their district, qualifications, and preferred location. Based on the district-wise demand for posts received from various departments and the eligibility/qualification criteria for those posts, UPNL forwards the names of enrolled candidates with the relevant qualifications to the concerned department for selection, following district-wise and priority order of nomination. As per the demand received from the department, UPNL sends the names of six enrolled candidates for each vacant post to the concerned department for consideration. The final selection of candidates is made by the department according to its rules, and the information is subsequently communicated to UPNL.

Akhil Bharatiya Samanvit Anusandhan Pari.details: The “Akhil Bharatiya Samanvit Anusandhan Pariyojana” is implemented by the Veer Chandra Singh Garhwali Uttarakhand University of Horticulture and Forestry under the Department of Horticulture, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to conduct research and improve important horticultural and forestry species, conserve their germplasm, provide improved seeds and saplings, and train farmers in using better techniques to enhance productivity.
Akhil Bharatiya Samanvit Anusandhan Pari.benefits: Under this scheme, research is conducted on selected species, including their conservation and germplasm preservation, studying possibilities for species improvement, quality testing, distribution of plants, and providing training.
Akhil Bharatiya Samanvit Anusandhan Pari.eligibility: 1. All farmers in Uttarakhand are eligible to receive the benefits.

application process.process: From time to time, Kisan Mitras are contacted directly by the Akhil Bharatiya Samanvit Anusandhan Pariyojana under various projects and are provided training through different programs. Additionally, farmers are informed through various communication channels about advanced seeds and improved seedlings, based on the achievements of these projects.

Banishree Scholarship.details: A Scheme of Scholarship for Students with special needs in the name of "**Banishree Scheme**" has been introduced by the Social Security and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities Department, Government of Odisha, to assist and encourage students to study as well as acquire technical/ professional/ vocational training. This scheme aims to offer some special allowances to disabled children so that they can pursue their education without any financial crunch.
Banishree Scholarship.benefits:
**Rates of Scholarship**
**A. Inside the State:** 

   1. Primary (Standard I to V): ₹400/-
   1. Middle and High School (Standard VI to VIII and IX to XI) (Not covered by the Government of India Scholarship) : ₹500/-
   1. College (+2 &amp; +3) (Not covered by the Government of India Scholarship) : ₹600/-
   1. College (P.G.) (Not covered by the Government of India Scholarship) : ₹700/-
   1. Technical and vocational training (Not covered by Govt. of India Scholarship) : ₹700/-

**B. Outside the State:**

   1. Students prosecuting normal course of study or technical/vocational/professional education/training not available in the State and not covered by Govt. of India Scholarship shall get ₹250 per month. 
   1.
